a7XiWLwNd2vT4OXG7HmSDw.text: ... they serve THRIFTY ICE CREAM. I grew up on Thrifty Ice Cream - YUM! They serve HUGE scoops & DELICIOUS fresh waffle cones. Cost all of $1.50 for a HUGE single scoop in a waffle cone. In addition, they serve all types of crepes, waffles & smoothies. Looking forward to trying some other delicious desserts.

jVC3azt829fxrg7WFbDrmg.text: Walking into The Crepe Shack was like walking into a delightful, sugary heaven. The smells of fresh crepes, ice cream, and fruit was amazing, and I was excited to try one of their delicious desserts.  There were lots of people there, so it was a little crowded and very overwhelming. The family in front of us took forever to decide on what to order, and they kept arguing, but the waiter was very attentive and patient with them, so I give him props for that.  I ordered the Banana Cheese Pie Crepe, which is a crepe filled with (my choice) vanilla ice cream and topped with sliced bananas, graham cracker crumbs, cheesecake bites, and drizzled with white chocolate syrup. It was a perfect sized portion, the service was super quick, and the presentation was marvelous.   I liked the idea of serving ice cream and toppings in a crepe, but I don't know if it was just me, but it was a little difficult to bite into. However, the taste itself was extremely delicious but subtle. It wasn't overpowered by abundant amounts of sugar, so it was really good after I got the hang of eating it.   Overall, The Crepe Shack was a beautiful place, and I'm so happy I came in here. Next time, I'm planning on trying a waffle. However, the crepe was amazing, and I would highly recommend it to all of the sweet tooths out there.

S0F7RVK3CLAOOS3kD4JpFQ.text: Friendly service and absolutely delicious! I would recommend this place to anyone. Place is clean and they even have board games to keep you entertained.

Mtu4LIxZWntcasllGv2O-Q.text: Awesome place to hang out with friends! I always get "The Classic" in crepe form. It's delicious! But I'm going to start asking if I can get my chocolate ice cream on the side because I don't like biting into my ice cream. But this place is soo good! 10/10 would recommend again!

gQvFNCU0YpPU_GLhRHcslQ.text: Crepes are love, and I was having a mad craving for this versatile treat. Coincidentally, so was my sister. Thus, are long trip across town to Crepe Shack & Waffles. As I stepped in this place was nice overall with its brightly covered walls, cleanliness, and friendly staff. As I got to the cash register, the cashier immediately informed me of their three most popular crepes: banana foster, rebel special, and tickle me berry!  I opted for tickle me berry with green tea icecream & cheesecake bites, and my sister kept it simple with the rebel special. BOTH WERE DELISH! You know that feeling when you bite into a dessert and there's just absolute bliss? Well, I experienced it. The berries were as fresh as can be and all of the flavors put together were perfect! I also tried my sisters and realized that no crepe is complete without Nutella. Her simple crepe was just as amazing.   I only give this place four stars because I feel like the crepe batter itself could have more flavor. My crepe was a bit thick and lacked clear flavor. Other than that, I guess the fun is what's in the crepes!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Tickle me Berry with cheesecake bites!

IIqMssmu714AUaD3i-m6Ng.text: Really super tasty and great to-go containers to keep the ice cream cold while the crepe is in tact. Love this place, our new favorite dessert spot in town!

lWLhyr5gqlkp23BgQE_qhg.text: Love this place!   Staffs are very friendly and the place is nice and clean. Since I live on the east side, this is a bit too far from me but for the quality of the food it is well worth it!   I ordered Strawberries, Kiwi Crepe with Vanilla IceCream and my best friend ordered Rocky road waffles with marshmallows. Both of them taste fantastic. Also before we ordered, the staff gave us a brief introduction about Japanese Crepes and gave us some recommendations for different items.   They are also selling cream soda. How come I never knew there was such thing! I felt totally left out for the 2.5 years being in America !   Will surely return!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Japanese crepe!
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. The Mix with vanilla ice cream
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Marshmallow whip cream chocolate ice cream waffles and coffee of course

-Ygls-htC04FJ585Q3NC8Q.text: So I've won a bet recently with my boyfriend and I wanted to go get dessert somewhere we have never been. I was doing my research and came across the reviews and the eye catching pictures that were posted by other Yelpers and thought this place would be best.   Walking into the Crepe Shack & Waffles already confirmed that I had chosen the right place. The smell of waffles and crepes being made in front of you was heavenly and sweet! The interior is also colorful, clean, and inviting. What made things even better was the option to come up with your own combination of ice cream, toppings, and syrup choice. Since it was my first time coming I went with the classic on a crepe cone, which came with banana, almonds, and nutella with my choice of vanilla ice cream. My boyfriend on the other hand had the strawberry sensation: strawberries, cheesecake bites, and strawberry syrup.   It was no surprise to us that the crepe cones were delicious hearing all the good things about this place, but the one thing we didn't care for was that they separated the ice cream from all the toppings. We thought it would have been much better to have our ice cream together with our syrup and toppings. It was like one side had ice cream and the other side nuts and nutella. Also the crepes tasted a bit bland. There was no flavor or sweetness of its own. We felt like this was something we could make at home.Other than that this place is good. I'm definitely coming back to try their cookie ice cream sandwich.

kSiaRXmcNZIoqkR9b2rsfA.text: The most amazing waffles I have ever tasted. Light and fluffy and to top them off thrifty ice cream. This place is a must visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Apple ala mode with vanilla ice cream! Amazing!!!
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry cheesecake with birthday ice cream

Rh9SLab0bn_hFWMnLoPQlw.text: Employees welcome you upon arrival, then the "fun" begins. Choose crepe or waffle and pick your ice cream or fruit. Or pick one of their "designs". Either way you won't be disappointed

XjAU2gVmh0IX7x_hrE0p2Q.text: Strawberries Nutella walnut and ice cream!!! Nothing special but I love it here. Crepes crepes and more crepes ...

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States

EbLceH7Cliwk7e4o2osHJw.text: I've never once been disappointed with Crepe Shack and I believe this was my 6th time!  Because I don't live in Henderson, it's pretty far (make another location, please!) but if I could I would probably get obsessed with the crepes here. If you haven't been here before, you order a crepe or waffle. There is a make-your-own crepe and waffle choice, where you can pick your own toppings and ice cream. There are some choices on another menu board for the crepes and waffles that already have suggested combination of toppings, you just pick your own ice cream.   Ex: Cookie Monster - Cookie Dough + Oreos + Peanut Butter w/ whatever ice cream you like!  My friends and I ordered:  1. Maui Fever CREPE - Shredded Coconut + Strawberry + Pineapple + Kiwi w/ green tea ice cream 2. East Meets West CREPE - Red Bean + Condensed Milk + Mochi Bites w/ green tea ice cream 3. Make-your-own crepe with mango, strawberries, cheesecake bites, whipped cream (and without ice cream) 4. East Meets West WAFFLE - Red Bean + Condensed Milk + Mochi Bites w/ green tea ice cream  My crepe was slightly crispy on the edges and chewy on the rest of it. I would've liked to to be more crispier but the batter tasted delicious, and the ice cream also softens up the crepe. I ordered the Maui Fever crepe but I prefer ones with chocolate so I might try for different. Overall, crepe was big and yummy, fruits are fresh, ice cream is creamy and the service is attentive and polite! I can't wait to come here again =)  There are pictures that I have posted up as well, so be sure to check those out!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. East Meets West Waffle (with green tea ice cream)
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Maui Fever (with green tea ice cream), East Meets West (with green tea ice cream, and a custom-made Crepe without ice cream.

F3Lz3oQi98eoUesEoqs66g.text: They make everything look good and I like having the choice of what to put on my waffle or crepe but the crepes are not delicious at all.  The crepes are a lot thinner and bland, basically like eating paper. If you haven't had a crepe before you might think it's good, but honestly I've had much better.   Stick to the waffles!

Jkp3sQwpnXY3u8NugbxhIA.text: Great place for a little dessert snack in between any errands you might have to run. They have a great selection of different kind of flavors from chocolatey to fruity. The service was great, as soon as we walked in we were greeted and asked if we have ever been there, and they also explained the menu to us making it a whole lot easier to order. The only thing I was disappointed about was that I found this place on my last day in Vegas and on the way going back home.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States

435tZGALFdBGqxdFK8payQ.text: Here's the quick and dirty. I can see how some people may like it here. However if you've ever had a real crepe this place won't do it for you. The toppings are very standard although they have lots, it's all sweet or sweeter nothing really exciting or new happening here.

MDs-tWigYigG_1ZAplQn7Q.text: Love the rebel special. Always my go to choice when coming here for a late night desert

6BrkdV9srKAkUqKhrTjIgw.text: Pretty good waffles and crepes. My kids really dig the nutella, peanut butter, strawberry and chocolate waffle. Good job guys! They all look like they're 16 years old and from the pimple crew lol

mSXe8sAEVCBMKWUzjh7ZWg.text: This place is basically perfect.  I came in with tempered expectations, thinking that I would enjoy the food but not be wowed by it.  Looking at the pictures, it obviously looks and sounds delicious, but I just assumed that the ice cream is added to mask bland and boring waffles and crepes.  Boy was I wrong!  The waffle and crepe stood out and were very fresh, the Thrifty ice cream was just a topping and I would have loved my food without the ice cream added!  Plus, there are endless possible combinations available, so you can do something different every time you go, and if you aren't looking for ice cream or something super sweet, you can substitute yogurt or extra fruit instead, which is awesome!  Highly recommend that everyone in the are give this place your business so that they can stay in business!  My one complaint....no soda fountain?  Just hot chocolate or overpriced drinks from a cooler.  Get a soda fountain guys, they are cheap, and each soda only costs you about 15 cents but you can charge a buck, so it will boost your profits.

aPGSewqCmjjNtYC3b9E7iQ.text: Awesome, affordable Crepes! Many different combos. Ate there this morning with my special lady friend we both left with smiles on our faces. We will be back.

aPYskqakxGkO3T1OvnC4fA.text: Japanese style crepes? Say what?? I had the pleasure to experience this Japanese delight and let's just say that maybe my selection wasn't all that great but everyone else seemed to enjoy theirs.   We went towards closing so there was hardly anyone there. Overall the place is clean but nothing that wows you when you walk in. I will admit that the bathrooms have pepto colored walls that it can stir up a bowel movement...just sayin'.  Anyways  moving on to the crepe, they're made to order so they're as fresh as it can come. Picture Cold Stone but with hand held crepes (waffle cone style). The scent of crepes lingers in the air and takes you to that delighful moment of bliss. They have a pre-made menu to select from or you can make your own. Truthfully, it's cheaper to choose their menu than to make your own.  Well I choose the one with caramel, brownie bites and marshmellows. Sugar shock indeed! The crepe was light and fluffy that it had a soft fortune cookie taste (as Paolo stated in prevvious review). Luckily they give you whatever ice cream flavor you want and whip cream so I played it safe by picking vanilla. Surprisingly I wasn't a big fan of it. I felt that they should have combined the items together instead of keep them separate. I didn't like having a bite of just marshmellows then the next bite was just brownie. It didn't please the palate very well. I knew I should of stayed with the Strawberry Sensation crepe!   In the end, this is a great place to get dessert crepes but in my opinion I would stick with the ones that offer some type of fruit as it balances out better than one with brownie or marshmellows. I only wish they offered non-dessert like crepes then I might give it 5-stars!

RstfYp5cHIMBq73ka7m6lQ.text: The place was clean, smelled good and they used fresh ingredients, those are the positive things I found about this place. I just wasn't a fan of these "Japanese" style crepes because of the thickness and heavy use of vanilla. I was expecting a variety of crepes and all they had were sweet which made the wife happy..at first. We are both very much into the traditional French Crepe which are much thinner and more egg based compared to the ones served at the Crepe Shack. The presentation as a cone was interesting and I had an issue with eating the crepe with plastic utensils. The lack of variety, savory and breakfast offerings, and the style of crepe, was the overall knock on this place.

D573vli_1nkb7CPEp9wx3Q.text: I LOVE this place. It is conveniently located down the street from my sister's school. My favorite is a build-your-own with cheesecake, graham crackers, bananas, whipped cream, and vanilla ice-cream.   Everyone who works there is super friendly and patient. I once was craving a crepe, but I was just getting off of work at 9:30pm--and they close at 10pm. I rushed home and picked up my sister (because she wanted one too) and we called the Crepe Shack and put in our order as I was rushing down St. Rose Pkwy. We made it there about 15 minutes before they closed, and when we arrived the staff was patiently finishing off our crepes. They even put then in little to-go boxes, and packaged the ice-cream separately so it wouldn't melt. I know first hand how annoying it is to have people run into an establishment while I'm trying to clean up, and they tolerated us with a smile on their face.  They offer punch cards (get your tenth crepe free!) and they offer a lot of discounts, especially if you subscribe to their text newsletters.   Clean establishment, great staff, great food--what more could you ask for?

mF4ikmdwlyNmmYTyult1CQ.text: Stopped by Crepe Shack for a very sweet lunch. Was my first visit, and I found the store very clean and the staff quite helpful. I got the Cookie Monster, and it was delicious. The ingredients were fresh and it was well made. Looking forward to returning one day.

tTdgk4JL6t24WpHCzsMtBQ.text: Very good crepes and priced very reasonably.  They have loads fruit, topping and ice cream of options and the waffles they serve are also great.  Everyone we've brought there to try the crepes/waffles has loved it.  The staff has always been friendly here and they run a clean establishment.  They have some board games for the kids to keep them busy while you wait or eat in.  They also have a punchcard system that, for every 10 crepes you buy, you get the 11th free.  With our family and a few friends eating there, it doesn't take terribly long to fill up a card on a few visits.  We will definitely keep coming back.

ikwBLjD3QpheDJUseyTg-A.text: Went to check it out after reading all the reviews and honestly, I was disappointed. I'm a fan of crepes, dessert and savory but not from Crepe Shack & Waffles. Great effort as everyone is super nice in there but there were a few things off with the crepe I had. First, when I got mine, it was cold, cold, cold! so the ingredients I chose didn't even melt together to create a warm, scrumptious flavor. The crepe itself was doughy and ended up being chewy. And I would suggest adding more ingredients so there's goodies near the bottom of the crepe rather than just having the chewy, doughy crepe to eat.

TaYTISZ_T7ZNOmSjOtvyTQ.text: Just came back from here with the boyf. This dessert was very disappointing. I'm sure some people will enjoy it, but to me, crepes should be light and airy...almost like a vehicle to get the other tasty deliciousness to your mouth. Here, the crepes are heavy and smell/taste like a sponge. The fillings of fruit are very fresh, that I will say. All the crepes seem to come with ice cream, but it's only one scoop and a small one at that. We for sure won't be back.

oQlis1BWXNqzwNZaDaYdMQ.text: Waffles were yummy and quick!  Glad we stopped in for breakfast.

XkwQG7UcJVZbAbX1EX0pHg.text: I recently moved back in to town and heard about this place through a bunch of friends who said places like bachi burger, five guys, and crepe shack were the best right now. As soon as you go in, a delicious smell hits you and you can't wait to get your crepe! I had the mix with raspberries instead of bananas, vanilla yogurt instead of ice cream, and it was awesome! I love the combination of fresh fruits with the sweet crepe. I actually lived in france for 3 years, so i've had my share of crepes. Although this is different from a french style crepe, which is more on the buttery, heavy side (not airy, just to add. a crepe is thin but not meant to be airy.. it's not a souffle), it was soooo enjoyable, with a fortune cookie taste. I've tried japanese style crepes a few times in cali, but nothing really struck me enough for me to crave them. But I can't wait to go try more crepes at cs&w! I'll definitely be back and recommend this place to everyone!

GjTaxA8y6ip1D1X91Tl7Vg.text: The place itself was nice, clean and they had board/card games for the customers to enjoy...the boy at the register however was rude and was trying to rush me ordering when it was my first time being there.  I ended up getting the rebels special with mango and it wasn't anything spectacular.

AsoxMd5bhGpSakBmpYoPQg.text: Great food,  great service,  and a cute atmosphere for a little strip mall place.  Happy customers, lots of flavor combinations and fast crepes for a reasonable price. Definitely gonna come back next time I'm in town!

dwZSSt2DxoIeJL5zII4EJA.text: Found this place on Yelp over a year ago and finally took the time to actually eat here for a late night dessert. It was definitely worth the drive coming from Summerlin when the freeway isn't too busy. I've read a lot of the reviews of this place and I do agree that it does live up to the hype if your a lover for Crepes. I like to call them JDM Crepes (any car enthusiast would understand lol).  Quality: The Crepe itself was soft and it was prepared neatly with all the additions of my order.  Service: The lady upfront was very helpful on what she recommended after wanting to try something with Strawberries and Blueberries. I ordered the "Make Me A Swirl" with Black Cherry ice cream and whip cream and it sure was beyond delicious =) (No more then 5 mins to receive my order)  Price: I like to consider it cheap for a desert for the serving size that is given. I paid $5.95 in total after taxes. I would probably be eating here more then getting a Boba drink.  Bring a date here for dessert and you'll definitely be scoring some points.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Tickle Me Berry
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Make Me A Swirl =)

IaH-BhGSd43wD8ny6811KA.text: Love love love this spot!! It's big n I don't understand why it's slow in there. This place has the best n greatest crepes I ever had ever!! I can't find any other place that had really really good tasting crepes!!! Want a great crepe?! Here it is, this is the place!!! Good prices, clean bathrooms n area to sit, games to play with radio music on. I will come here every time I visit Vegas!! I hope they stay open don't want this business to close coz I can't find any great tasting crepes like this ever!! It's a must

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States

nodVP04TEoLAt5n092Fd2w.text: Stumbled upon this place a little while ago & their crepe's are absolutely to die for! It's such a cute place, they even have little games for you to sit, eat & play :)

fMreDr9vTuaMTnJ9mWemhg.text: Super fast crepe makers, create your own combination if you want! They turn it into a cone shape for you to take to go - very easy to enjoy. Tons of flavor combos to choose from. Place is very clean as well. Service is decent. 4.5/5

4n2XkxfJrTuhrlyXN0uYPw.text: This place is phenomenal! They offer a wide variety of crepe sensations or you can have it over a waffle. If you don't find their creations to your liking, you can opt for a creation of your own. There are so many choices, you might want to try them all.  This place is a must whenever I have family and friends in town, they are never disappointed! They often tell me they had a craving for Crepe Shack after they return home.   The atmosphere is fun and comfortable. There are games and music, plus crepe deliciousness!   Lookout Crepe Shack, I'm bringing another newbie this week!

rDIm0gSPOeMhJq0gAwpJZA.text: I was on vacation In Vegas and decided to make a special trip out to Crepe Shack in the nearby town of Henderson.  It was only a 20 minute drive from the strip...we were out driving around and wound up close to it anyway.    The dude who rang us up was very friendly and offered my husband and I some recommendations.  I ordered the "Rebel Special" crepe... which is filled with strawberry, banana, and nutella.  These are Japanese style crepes, which get rolled up and eaten with your hands like a delicious crepe burrito.  My hubby and I were starving so we also shared a bananas foster waffle.  Both the crepe and the waffle were to die for.  They did not skimp on the toppings.  The waffle was crisp and cooked perfectly.  The crepe was one of the best I've ever had.  Whenever I'm back in Vegas again, I will definitely hit up Crepe Shack again.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Bananas foster waffle
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Rebel Special

U6BryLYrXr7UJ33Pryq6Tw.text: After looking at the pictures of their delicious creations, I had to check it out for myself.    Before this, I've only had the traditional crepes that are rolled with sauce and toppings drizzled over it.   Here they have Japanese crepes.   It is filled with the dessert toppings and scoop of ice cream of your choice.  They have many options with pre-determined filling.  It's great for people like me who can't make a decision.     The crepes and waffles are made there when you order.  I chose the banana cheese pie crepe filled with cheesecake, white chocolate sauce, bananas, graham crackers and whipped cream.  Can I get a hell yeah?! I went with vanilla ice cream so it wouldn't take away from the others toppings.  The crepe itself is formed into a waffle cone shape to hold all of the goodness.  I loved it! It's different and fulfills my sugar craving.  A friend of mine ordered a dessert waffle.  Honestly it was just ok.  I'd choose the crepe over that.     Service was great.  Both gentlemen were very helpful and friendly.  They made our first visit a delight! I am happy to add this to my dessert list!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana cheese pie crepe- bananas, cheesecake, white chocolate.  Yum!

zRBO1QEQiaNtb8OTkQULrQ.text: Not the best flavor crepe but still very good and i love the idea and menu. We built it ourself and it was worth it

lcVTVA4JmxDA2_eupZS4SA.text: A great place to bring your kids for a sweet treat! A simple place to relax, play some board games and try a variety of different crepes.

5U0qTk6MzpiexcvZuyH95Q.text: One of my absolute places in the area, I have so many fond memories of this place.   First off, it's dessert crepes, Japanese style, meaning the crepe acts almost like a cone which is then filled with whatever toppings plus ice cream you want! The crepes are absolutely delicious.  Plus they also have waffles which are also good!  My favorite crepes are Strawberry Sensation (strawberries and cheesecake bites) or the Cookie Monster (cookie dough, peanut butter and oreos)  Being so close to Coronado High School, I used to go there and eat crepes while playing games and chatting with my friends. It's a great place and I always love coming here.

WPBFYBGrhvRhPSYekaji7g.text: Always enjoy coming here with kids for some ice cream and treats. The service is always excellent. I left my wallet there over the weekend, and the owner went out of his way to locate me and returned the wallet to me the next day. I can't thank him enough for such a nice deed. It says a lot about how he runs his business. We will be loyal customers for life!!

MkrW0jSQ_WrX_atcAb5kuQ.text: That smell though. =)  That's the first thing that invites you in, is that yummy aroma of crepes & waffles.  It is always clean and bright inside and the staff is always friendly.  They are patient and will help you choose the right flavor.  I usually stick with the following choices: (forgive me if I can't remember the exact names)  - East meets West. Great combination of red bean, condensed milk and mochi. Best topped off green tea ice cream. I prefer this as a crepe.  - Strawberry cheesecake.  I love this on a waffle and get strawberry cheesecake ice cream and extra condensed milk syrup.  - Bananas foster.  I prefer this on a waffle as well.  - Apple pie a la mode. I love the flavors of apple pie and this is great as a crepe or waffle.  Another plus is that they use Thrifty ice cream.  I like chocolate malt crunch and birthday cake.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Banana cheese pie crepe with chocolate ice cream
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Blueberry cheesecake ice cream with cheesecake bites!

N9Wk2vX1fLCl11o9_tc9gg.text: I love coming here for lunch. Yes, I said LUNCH!  I usually get a delicious crepe with their low fat yogurt instead of ice cream.  So far, I have only had 2 kinds, make me swirl and apple ala mode.  Today's choice was the ape ala mode and it's just as delicious as the first time I had this flavor.  Every time I go in, there is usually no one else in there so it's quiet and service is really fast.  They make the crepe fresh in front of you and slice the fruit in front of you too.  It's fun to watch them make your crepe!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States

Xm7fcSGChEkLuwW9yiwMtg.text: I loved the 'East Meets West' crepe. It had red bean, condensed milk, mochi and I added green tea ice cream. It was a perfect blend! No complaints about the ingredient ratio. The red bean was very fresh; my boyfriend and I could tell that it was good quality. The green tea ice cream was delicious as well - it had just the right amount of sweetness.   Definitely will be coming back to try more of these Japanese Style Crepes and waffles! Especially since the staff was so nice and helpful to us :)

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. East Meets West Crepe!

32dDslQ4EWCjmLI63C3EOQ.text: I love this place!!! My favorite crepe place ! I drive 30 mins to get there but it's sooo worth it! also, did you guys change owners? cause recently i went in and everything was different. menus, workers.ect all different?

SMuIDriqeCgYTKYLGD0CtQ.text: The place is nice but I came with 3 boys and they were such in a rush to be done with us that I forgot to show him the 10%, when I showed it to him he said he couldn't apply it anymore because he already run the charge, oh well they didn't treat me well. Next!

e3-HdrzzGRYDDnoVDnQ3Bg.text: I absolutely love love love this spot!  My favorites here would have to be the waffles of course. I'm the type of person who likes my crepes hot and on a plate, not in my hand, so this review is mainly for their waffles.  I am a waffle and crepe expert myself seeing that I did work in a little shop just like this for a long time. And this guy knows what he's doing. He's a great cook and very fast and efficient. You can tell he loves what he's doing. His employees are also really  friendly and helpful.  If you're in the area I would definitely hit up this spot! Anything goes good with waffles and crepes.  My favorite is the rebel special waffle. Every time I eat here the waffles are fluffly and crispy and WARM!  Kudos.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Rebel Special Waffle.

Pk1EqErcKL7n2rotQuwpqw.text: Japanese crepes are better than French crepes! If you've ever been to Japan, you've seen the small crepe stands that occupy every mall, festival and street corner. Japanese crepes are made with icecream, fruit and whipped cream. No veggies and meat!!!! Crepe shack and waffles serve only Japanese style dessert crepes.  The second you open the door the sweet smell of crepes will hit you. There are a ton of board games for you to play and the restaurant is large enough that you can spend a good chunk of time there without other customers giving you the stink eye to leave so they can sit.  Choose your crepe flavor and then choose your icecream (Thriftys!)  My favorite is the Rebel Special with butter pecan icecream.   They are really big on you eating crepes the "proper" way and thus don't have spoons out for you to use. Ask one of the guys behind the counter and they'll give you one :)  Cute, cute date spot!  There's a Trader Joes next door :)

Bwfx57Vh9XTEyZZr7Oq9xw.text: I was really in the mood for dessert last night and this place sounded like it would hit the spot.   My first thoughts when entering the store was bright, clean and simple. After starring at the menu for a few minutes the cashier asked if it was our first time here and then told us all the different options they offered, their most popular items and then his personal recommendations. They have smoothies, Thriftys ice cream, Japanese style crepes and waffles. He definitely made choosing my dessert a little easier.   I ended up making my own waffle with green tea ice cream, strawberries, almonds and condensed milk. I fell in love with the green tea icecream! I just wished my waffle was a bit more crispy. My boyfriend ordered the strawberry sensation crepe. I took a bite of his and it was delicious. I prefer the crepe over the waffles.   I was never a big crepe fan but this place has converted me. Wonderful service/staff and yummy dessert!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Customized waffle, strawberries, almonds, condensed milk and green tea ice cream
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry sensation crepe with strawberry ice cream

noHqJGlDf5zQIeTG6fU0UA.text: My new go to place when I'm looking for some sweets.   Friendly staff and they are fast. It's fun watching them make your treats. Decent pricing as well. It's better than going to Baskin Robbin (My all time fav ice cream store) and paying a couple bucks for one scoop when I get an ice cream scoop on top of waffles along with some fresh fruits for a couple more bucks.

MI7lmJWjsW4xKAoFx8GZ7g.text: My friends and i came here around 8 tonight. My friend is really allergic to kiwis. We saw the couple in front of us get kiwis in their crepe. My friend requested if they would wipe the knife and cutting board, or maybe even use a different portion of the cutting board where the kiwi wasnt cut. The kind gentleman who was taking the order asked the guy making the crepe (apparently its usually the same guy) and he was SO RUDE. He looked so irritated and shook his head and said NO . I was just really taken back and i stared at him and he just stared back at me like wtf do you want me to do. I was just so.. at a loss of words. She ended up not getting anything and it was so awkward.. the cashier felt so bad he apologized to us and gave us coupons which i gave to another friend. But really, I wonder how he would feel if someone did that to him or someone important to him. Btw he ended up wasting material anyway because he made her order without realizing she ended up not getting it.

gljLspgaARxPjJs7WMjYvw.text: A friend of mine showed me this gem and I am eternally grateful.  The staff is very friendly and the owner is always there so that's something to admire. The interior is extremely clean and simple. Very refreshing. I get the Rebel Special every single time with two scoops of vanilla, it's one of my favorite things to snack on. I've gone through at least three of the stamp cards and I talk about this place all the time.  I also love the fact that they sell little asian goodies and delicious beverages.

BVaZDp0meAN7zQ5PZyqsQA.text: Crepe shack is so delicious. The two flavors I would recommend are the rebel special and cap'n berry. They also sell a variety of drinks, ice creams. You can even get a waffle instead of a crepe if that is what you prefer. The people here are friendly. They also have board games that you can play. Great place to hangout and chill.

qqtDEhQq6GHzXz4J65Jglw.text: While I am a huge traditional (French) crepes fan, I am now a Japanese crepes fan! Our crepes were light and fluffy but...sturdy? They didn't rip at the slightest touch, perfect for the cone-shaped serving method (as opposed to the folded French style).  Each crepes comes with a scoop of ice cream and real whipped cream. The fillings are up to you, and they have a huge selection! Nutella, tons of fresh fruit, sauces, brownie bits, and tons more.  I went with the bananas foster (vanilla ice cream, of course). It was a decadent creation with ripe bananas, cinnamon, and a great caramel sauce. Between the wrapped layers of crepes, they had sprinkled cinnamon sugar. Great attention to detail! Husband went with the Take Me Away (chocolate ice cream). Brownie bits, marshmallows, and caramel. His was very good too, but we both agree mine was the winner.  Can't wait to be back in Vegas to try some of the fruit creations...

4fYQO400Xj6xgwqGpuuGTw.text: Over the past year, I have come here more times then I can count... far more then the number of checkin's showing on this review, and I must say, while my girlfriend is a huge fan of the crepes, I am a huge fan of the waffles. I mean, it's like being a little kid all over again and being able to pick and choose all the topping you wanted on the waffle without your parents vetoing it.   In addition to their awesome crepes and waffles, the staff here are pretty solid and are constantly checking on you to make sure everything is ok and your happy. Add in the fact they recently just started to stock Thrifty brand ice cream, and now we have a perfect match.   Oh and they have board games to! All the classic ones like Battleship, Jenga, Operation and Connect-4

OBTmETW3MrvxXJ6MnljsZw.text: First timer, the worker chris helped me out with toppings and what ice cream to get. He was a very great help. Great personality, service, and hair. Also, this crepe he made was amazing 10/10. Its like god gave him the hands to craft such greatness. Just simply beautiful. Thanks again chris, hope his manager gives him some recognition because this is a classy guy. God bless. Pece.

ViKZnLt_GFd8uDJW_fmhUA.text: I drive all the way from Summerlin just for a crepe :)

p6yqkweAuC3emv_9sRN3bQ.text: This place is the best!!  Beautiful, crisp, fresh atmosphere.  Friendly, super helpful staff.  Pretty reasonable prices.  Food is AMAZING! You can watch them make your crepe or waffle, and they definitely know what they're doing.  Everything is so fresh and delicious.

r43vFX90S1AXRX-EpQUdgQ.text: Staff here was very helpful & nice. The cashier guy offered to open up my root beer bottle even though it was only a twist off, which was really nice. I ordered the banana foster crepe, which is the third most popular crepe they have. I think the filling inside the crepe is good, but the taste of the crepe isn't the greatest. I think they should also have savory crepes here, but they don't. I saw there was a few board games in the corner to play with such as sorry or even Jenga! I felt this place was more like a high school hangout. I plan on coming here again & try more of their flavors they have on their menu.

C0UYwoz7Ao5uw4EGc3wrsw.text: Excellent batter makes excellent crepes. These guys really do a great job of making crispy crepes and filling them with fresh fruit and other goodness.   I really enjoyed the Bananas Foster and the East Meets West. Definitely add strawberries to the East Meets West. It's so yummy!   Definitely will be back for more... too bad I don't live on this side of town... sigh...

LyG3S78QkYFBp6xDPCvFZg.text: Nutty Buddha! Need I say more...?  My favorite guilty pleasure............... when I want to cheat - I make a bee line for you!  Kind of embarrassing when the owner / manager knows your order as you are walking thru the door... lol  for those who love Thrifty ice cream - look them up!  staff are very friendly!  your constant companion,  ~deirdra

9H99wEj5TBr0VHNPDFdD8A.text: Love The Crape Shack.  Best place to go for your ice cream fix.  We ordered three Rebel Specials...Banana Strawberry and Nutella with a scoop of ice cream. We chose vanilla.  We also ordered a Maui Fever....MY FAVORITE...Kiwi, Pineaple, Coconut flakes with Pineaple Coconut ice cream.  So much better than your normal cake or waffle cone.  Definitely give this place a try.

rTvxdHoVOeyvyhaFjuP5CQ.text: Crepes are delicious, and this place has a billion ways to eat them. There's plenty of seating and BOARD GAMES!! I love pigging out on crepes and playing connect four, Families should go here, not families should go there, I will be there. The staff is always sweet, and fun. I frequent the crepe shack on a regular basis, and will continue to do so. I wish I could build a crepe shack in my back yard.

a3_bSDS0ojSMBWRuGwBK5Q.text: My one go-to stop when I'm craving crepes. Best in the town plus they have some board games you can play while hanging out enjoying their delicious crepes. #cravingssatisfied

VwxOE7gnc_Iv2xDnTkZtTw.text: Place is great, delicious crepes and waffles... Very reasonably priced... Friendly staff...

u5CITfee2shOr8vlGYh_fg.text: Not only are the crepes amazing every time, the staff is also outstanding. I've gone here since they've opened. Never a disappointment and always a great treat!!

3vmQyuXViqmah1xacNJ94w.text: I love this place. The ppl that work here are awesome and attentive.   The dessert speaks for itself. The crepes are light and airy with unlimited fresh toppings to please any taste buds!  I love cool local places like this!

1tc8is7POud2Z0P4irZaSQ.text: Yum!  This place is a real treat.  We love crepes, so we had to try it.  We love the Rebel Special (we swap out the bananas for extra strawberries).  The crepes are made fresh to order, so they're warm and soft.  The ice cream (we like chocolate) is cold, and the fruit is sliced fresh in front of your eyes.  Rolled up like a soft ice-cream cone, it's a hand-held treat.  Reasonable prices, fresh ingredients, and they make it quickly.  It's about a 15-20 minute drive from the Strip area, but it's worth it.

EZW0HAaOy2ET5VqgR2S40g.text: Ok...I am certainly a fan. I had the pleasure of eating here the other day after dinner. They have a convenient groupon now deal every night that saves you three bucks if you're in the mood for a tasty desert.  First things first-- the staff is very friendly and they will be more than happy to direct your ordering and help you customize your treat. I went with the rebel special at their suggestion and decided the plain vanilla yogurt would best enhance its flavor. It was an irresistible combination of strawberry, banana and nutella-- although I could have gone with a bit more tasty nutella.  My girlfriend opted for the tango mango which contained delicious coconut and condensed milk as well as some in house made vanilla ice cream.  They make their food right in front of you so you know you're not getting any shady business when you eat here. There is a huge selection on crepes and ice cream which they make themselves so you can try something different every night.   We will definitely be back here the next time we have an irresistible craving for tasty desserts.

1xFciY7gvp60krMkKphsDA.text: Always amazing!!! Consistent and friendly service.  My kids crave there crepes.  They make it look so easy!!!

Uipntzv-QAe-1fEAECsnhw.text: Had been wanting to check this place out for awhile. Finally did today and was not disappointed!  When you walk in the door you are instantly greeted by the warm smell of freshly made crepes and waffles. The staff is super friendly and patient while you decide what creation to try. If you have never been there before they also give menu suggestions based on what they're most popular fare is. The mixture of fruit, ice cream, and either freshly made crepe or waffle is such a fun idea. There are literally hundreds of combinations! I will definitely be going back again and recommending to all of my friends!

jme5wQByz6YDYXL9BCqE5A.text: Fun place- crepe was delicious!  The only part that was hard was which one to pick!  Staff was super patient and pleasant. I even got extra strawberries

rT6PT2Wbl0OPOBSEMGbSAQ.text: I've been going here for years but I just started yelping so I feel I should give this place the credit it deserves. I'm very big on desserts, especially crepes and cool, different looking food. The way I found this place was through a few friends post on social media. It looked really delicious and I had to join the hype and try it. As soon as you go in, the atmosphere is really inviting, nice music, pretty painted walls, and pictures of crepes and waffles hung up. When you get to the cashier they'll always ask at first if you've been there before, unless they recognize you which they usually do for me now lol. Anyways at first I wanted the Rebel Special, which is one of the most popular but I can't have banana. Hearing that, the cashier told me I could make any kind of crepe, so of course I took advantage of that. I got a crepe with vanilla ice cream, Nutella, blackberries, strawberries, whipped cream, and cheesecake bites. And omg when I ate it, it was so delicious! They also use Thrifty's ice cream which makes it even better. The batter they use is good too because I've also tried this order with a waffle and waffle or crepe, they both taste so good and different than other crepes/waffles. This place truly is so good, I go so often the owner has memorized my order. I'm just waiting until he finally names it after me ;) lol but really though, once you go you'll come back, they always do!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Special crepe I always get vanilla/strawberry ice cream, Nutella, blackberries, strawberries, whipped cream and cheesecake bites

GbULoZAzwDx97zjP7MRC5Q.text: I've been searching for a good dessert place in Henderson and I finally found one. When we walked in this place, we could smell the sweet aroma from the waffle and crepes batter. We were greeted by a friendly cashier who explained everything to us. And when our crepes came out, they were delicious! Would definitely go back!.

cSLCTjGJw6cpeWtFKDGjrQ.text: I've driven past this place many times and always wondered if it was any good.  So the other day while being dragged to Trader joes by the wife, We decided to give it a shot.  The thing that really brought me in was the thrifty ice cream sign as it brings back childhood memories of actual thrifty retail stores in so. California that served ice cream near the cash wrap.  Upon entering it was completely empty and I thought maybe we made a mistake, But alas one of the staff members approached us and asked if this was our first time and he then proceeded to explain the menu and the fact that the crepes are Japanese style, meaning they are rolled like a burrito in the shape of an ice cream cone. He recommended a few things and we ended up getting the rebel and a waffle cone with rainbow sherbert and black cherry. The crepe was very delicious and the thrifty ice cream tasted just as I remember.  The staff was very friendly and helpful and the treats were excellent! We will be returning.  A Solid 4 star establishment.

_Mshvj3BeWqZ30reU0plmQ.text: Lei has done an incredible job!  The simplicity, creativity, style, and taste is unmatchable.  The store is very nice and clean! Plenty of room to sit and enjoy your creation!  I Totally challenge the skeptical to taste them, you'll be hooked. Keep up the good work!

p7BY53GPD3LlXaBXV2xVrg.text: I liked it and it was very good. However it was too sweet for me and I was on a sugar high after eating here.  I order the Maui Fever with green tea ice cream and I sampled the Banana Foster which I really didn't like.

2UcCMP_KFFFVLlBfRC9UgQ.text: I always custom order a crepe and it's always good. They usually will hint to me if my combination is risky. This place is always on my list of places to visit when I come to town.

p5G-rbU1nPRc7ZkeyH_axg.text: I was so excited to try a waffle at The Crepe Shack...but when we got there at 10:38 a.m. on Monday February 29th they were still closed.  Yelp said they opened at 10:30 a.m. and so did the sign on their window.  No lights were on, nobody was inside.  We waited until almost 11:00 and still nobody came to open the restaurant.  I was bummed, so I went onto Yelp, looked up Waffles again and found another restaurant called Egg Works.  I am now eating a delicious Harvest waffle which was highly recommended by our polite and friendly waiter Rob and am a happy camper!  Crepe Shack lost two new customers and Egg Works gained two new customers!

m1D7fW6hUQS5vNv3lutwog.text: The guys here are always so cheerful!! My son loves their selection of ice cream and I have never had a crepe until here. I come at least once every few weeks and I absolutely love it!! To die for crepes!!! The bomb dot com!!  They also have board games you can play while enjoying your crepes or ice cream.

2daV5CCG3dZf48AqaJrPcA.text: Both their large waffles and loaded crepes are great. I honestly think you can't go wrong here. They have a huge selection of flavor combinations and their fruit is fresh and ripe. The staff is nice and separated our ice cream since we took it to go. I have a new favorite spot to cure my sweet tooth. Only reason I didn't offer 5 stars was that the crepe was a bit softer than I'm used to from crepe shops but that's just my preference.

qvLPCy_nG1-KGhWh7ay6Gw.text: I have been wanting to stop in here for a while; I finally did and was not disappointed!! The staff was extremely friendly, knowledgeable and helpful!! The decor was minimal but colorful; loved it!! I will definitely be going back!

VNr1NQflDVJNtijwHTceCQ.text: This place is the bomb. My first experience with Japanese crepes and absolutely loved them. I am a fresh fruit kind of guy and their menu had awesome options to try several different flavors. The alternative yogurt to the ice cream makes me feel like I am eating super healthy. We found this place on a weekend stay and went back multiple times. Still full from just having dinner I still bought an extra and one to go they were so good. Fresh, clean, and awesome.

M4Bu4Yod3orntcgP8zPKJA.text: I felt the ice cream was better than the crepe. The crepe itself (minus the extra ingredients) is plain and has no taste. For me, what makes a great crepe is the batter, and the batter is plain as paper. I wish I could love it more. What I did like and would return for more is their cookie sandwich ice cream!

Wy2X5h9NShntUcnjLEr0og.text: Well, after waiting months for it to open, I was a bit disappointed. Don't get me wrong, the freshness and quality are great for the price, but it still is a bit lacking. It really wasn't enough of a "breakfast/lunch" type menu. No meats really, everything is virtually cold. Most of the items are a "build your own" option, and if not guided by an employee, the finished products can be boring.    Ordered: *Bananas with Waffle. It was just that. Plain but fresh. Should have added ice cream or whipped cream.  *Crepe with Apples, Almonds & Caramel Sauce. Caramel was runny, and settled in the bottom of the cone, leaving the rest dry. But fresh none the less. * Chocolate Chip Waffle with ice cream & Bananas Foster Crepe.   Suggestions & Comments: - Need real utensils. Eating waffles with plastic forks is not good.  - Some food just needs to be warm. The crepes are cold, fillings and fruit are cold... maybe get a griddle or electric skillet, or even a microwave to eat toppings. An offering of meat toppings would be good too. Eggs, sausage, bacon, etc...  - Offer a plated crepe option so they can be eaten more evenly. - Food is messy. add napkins/holders/wetnaps on each table.  - Employees need to suggest items or give samples. Several customers came in, read the menu, and then left. :(  Overal, I don't think I'll be returning any time soon unless they're are some BIG changes. I do appreciate the freshness and quality for the price. I'd happily bring my vegetarian toddler here for a quality treat afterschool. And that is a good thing :) better to take the kids hear then just about every local fast food joint.

oOwJUnvi91yFJUKdOpPPKw.text: I was only visiting town for a couple of days but every night after dinner we went to this place. It's simply awesome. The idea is different and works wonderfully. 10/10 would recommend. My only gripe is that they don't have a shop where I live.

92Jej2rirzUHi2aQvr9D0Q.text: Kiddi got Bananas Foster Crepe & I got the Rebel Special..yummmmmm!Two stars b/c they only have sweet fillings & the crepe itself falls apart.

JegafyyLTu3lUdllgnTWKA.text: What a waste of time. I was in town, visiting with my sister and wanted to grab a quick snack. So I found a Groupon deal that read $7 for two waffles/crepe. With that said, you would presume that meant what it's stated. $7 for 2 (TWO) Waffles or Crepe. But nope, they take the cost displayed per item, which was about $5 - $6 per waffle/ or crepe. And then ended up ordering a mocha and a bottle of water. The total came out to be $25 (which the cashier subtracted $7), the total being $18. So not only did Groupon charge me $7 but the place charged me $18. I paid a total of $25 for two crepes/waffles and two beverages, which is the original cost. The cashier said he already took the deal into account. SO basically, there is no deal.   It's really deceptive advertising, and I'm a marketer myself. You don't lie like that. Crepe Shack & Waffles you should be ashamed of yourself!

G3LhXC06rpjZNnKKVyUESA.text: Visited this place with the wife as we were craving crepes after watching a special on Food Network! :)  The previous reviews are fantastic, so we drove on a Saturday evening - the place was empty, so we walked right up to the counter and were greeted with a smile and a question if this was our first time.  The cashier provided us with an explanation of the different, Japanese-style crepes as compared to what is traditionally found in this country.  I was in the mood for green tea ice cream and ordered the East meets West crepe which included red beans and motchi along with the green tea ice cream.  My wife ordered a berry, chocolate concoction.  Both crepes were tasty, although, certainly different than the crepes we were used to.  I would come back again and try their waffles or their crepes again if I am in the mood for a light snack.

ZgDQv7ul47QNnuKLRrNPWQ.text: Love this place! The crepes are awesome my favorite is the strawberry Nutella crepe! The ice cream is good too. I also love the chocolate mint tea!

2fG9kf0bgWEANdCj1Dh9RA.text: Sooo delicious.  East meets west, added brownie toppings.  We were very satisfied.  Lots of choices, flavors, and combos you can choose from.  Workers was very polite and the restaurant was very clean.  We couldn't resist so we also made a take out of two crepes.

W1S-qvDCKiknbvMRffAzGw.text: The crepe desert was pretty good not great by any means  The bathrooms are disgustingly dirty, and the walls in the restaurant area are dirty and disgusting  makes you wonder if the food prep. Area is clean. they do have an A rating from the health apartment  so I have to assume we are good there Clean up your place

gWd9OcRRWPJTwjj1z_9iIg.text: If you love Thrifty Ice Cream you will love it even more along with these Japanese style crepes.  More of a waffle type batter and crispier in texture compared to french crepes.  They have various premade combinations that you can choose from.  Combining Thrifty ice cream, fresh fruit, along with other toppings, all wrapped into an easy to hold cone shape.    They also have the same options to top onto a waffle. Also available are cookie sandwiches!  Great dessert stop!! Must try.

jL6VJ8TWcHaxyARJjUm8Fw.text: Nice spot to grab some ice cream. The little ones got 2 scoop ice cream with some toppings. Good variety of ice cream flavors and toppings. Healthy serving of ice cream  so 1 scoop would of been more than enough for them . Sister got the Campfire s'mores crepe and I got the campfire s'mores waffle. Definitely could of served two with the waffle.   We went on a cloudy day around 4:30 so it was pretty quiet.   Prices pretty reasonable and spent $22.05 for 4. 9hT0GhNcBtDHdsoNft_KLA.text: It is impossible to review a business that has been closed both times I tried to patronize it. On Tuesday, August 28, 2018,  there was a sign in the door saying that they were closed for a team training and would reopen on Wednesday, August 29, at 2PM. On August 29,  I saw a sign in the door and tables stacked with no lights on. I did not go up. I tried calling, getting no answer. They were closed again.   August 31, positive experience today! Open sign was on and staff greeted us at the door with a big smile. Trainee at the crepe maker, whipping out crepes like a "machine!" Cones are a little hard to eat without wearing a good portion "on" your belly. I live in CA, but will stop by again when I am back in town!

9CjvOnTB9TWOHRlcac28PQ.text: I am used to traditional French crepes, but these Japanese style crepes are so good! The staff is always friendly and the vibe inside is fun with bright colors and board games available! Good ice cream, good crepes, good speciality combinations. Love it! I got the Take Me Away speciality crepe with chocolate malted krunch ice cream

0ghEl_BvWlljy2t-MWdfLg.text: This place has a lot of options. They have some of their specialties which you can choose to have the topping on either a waffle or a crepe. You can put ice cream on the crepe as well. I got the take me away crepe with cookies and creme ice cream. The crepe had brownie bites, marshmallows and caramel on it. It was really good. They have a lot of parking spots and the place is in a nice area. The bathrooms are clean and nice. The place is not generally too packed so you can sit down with your family or friends to eat and enjoy your dessert.

9reJ_vYAUydiXQz6zPvyog.text: This was only the 2nd time  we've been here but it was as good as the first time. No pics because was scarfed them down fast, LOL.   Crepes are not too crispy which can cause it to break and your toppings fall out so it's a good thing. It was almost sponge cake like for such a thin sheet. Toppings and crepes themselves were not too sweet. I believe they use fresh whip cream. Everything balanced out well.   You can build your own or order from their menu creations.   What we ordered:  Plain waffle w/ whip cream on the side  Plain crepe w/ cheese cake bites and whip cream  Rock at the road crepe which had marshmallows, almonds and white chocolate syrup and choice of ice cream, we got chocolate (rocky road cream inspired)  Revel crepe w/ strawberries, bananas, Nutella and whip cream and choice of ice cream, we got vanilla

fiwnZk_Lgmn3eu2gIqIcKQ.text: Ok I don't like crepes. I went here with my husband who loves them. This is the best one I ever ate. Usually they taste tooooo eggy. This made me a fan.

The waffles are made fresh in front of you, so when they are served they are hot.  This is a perfect dessert spot.    Customer service is also wonderful.  They provide wonderful selections, all you have to do is tell them what you are craving and they have you covered.

To52cGHuiiWO3HwaGDILOg.text: Walking in then restaurant is very clean and has a open feeling to it.  I got the the rebel special and my boyfriend got the Cookie Monster waffle. I love crepes! I used to get the all the time in SF japantown. The crepe batter is a little thicker than back home but it is still very good. The person making the crepe knows what he is doing. He is quick making the crepes to. When we sat down he almost got the first crepe done. They also use thrifty ice cream! The waffle was fluffy and delicious. The staff is very friendly. We will come back again.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States

BweMDXIPvZyzfHThsF6Rng.text: I never really crave crepes, but I happened to be in the restaurant next door so my boyfriend and I stopped by. We had a crepe with Nutella and Strawberries. These are the Japanese version of crepes where you'll basically receive the crepe as if it's an ice cream cone. Speaking of ice cream cones, you can also get Thrifty ice cream on top! But no offense, I've never been impressed with Thrifty. I just like the idea of ice cream with my crepe.  I didn't get the ice cream, though, because I don't like how high the messiness potential is when you're holding such a thin crepe with ice cream in a piece of wax paper. I would prefer to get it on a plate or something. But like I said, I got a crepe with Nutella and strawberries, topped with whip cream (pretty sure it was reddi whip). You can't really go wrong with that, so obviously I'm going to say it was exactly what I expected and it was good because it was.  If I come back and order something else, I'll update the review. I'm not seeing that happening any time soon, but you never know--I just might crave some crepes one day.

h63WvGIRK0Gw6ZRUVUvfOQ.text: Holy crepe! I love this place. So much so that I went two days in a row. The crepes are delicious, the people are cool, and the crepes are delicious!  I didn't really know what "Japanese Crepe" meant, but I am all in. They explained that the batter is less eggy and this results in a crepe that kind of tastes like a fortune cookie. I'd have to agree. On my first visit, I went with the Strawberry Sensation (strawberries/cheesecake/strawberry syrup) with strawberry ice cream. Yum! The next day, I went with the Rebel Special (strawberry/banana/nutella) with green tea ice cream. This combination didn't match the previous day, but it was still good. The crepe is rolled into what resembles an ice cream cone. So with the scoop of ice cream in there, it basically feels like you are eating an ice cream cone.  Make sure you check in on your Yelp app to get 10% off your crepe. Make sure to also get your punch card to get your tenth one free. I usually don't fill up punch cards, but I can see this place getting repeat visits from me, despite how far south it is located.  I haven't tried their waffles and I probably never will. But for a delicious crepe snack/dessert, five stars all the way!

yNpvpxOfe_avEHEZUyMasw.text: Few places have pushed me to update, and none have received a second update, except for the Crepe Shack. Hearing from the owner, himself, about the new waffle batter, it was only right to go in to check it out. The edges were crispy and the center was spongy. The batter was delicious by itself. The taste and consistency is close to the waffles that I ate while in Asia. If you want something simple and classic ask for it with cinnamon, a dusting of powder sugar, and some maple syrup on the side.   Their crepes might be what draws me in, but the food talk is what has me constantly coming back. It is refreshing to see people who show pride in what they do. The enthusiasm that they show in striving to produce the best product is a draw. It would be easy to just cut up everything ahead of time or make a fruit preserve, instead they use all fresh produce and prep as they go. I also like how Li acknowledges the new crepe joint, but sees that they each have their own unique niche.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Tickle me berry with raspberry sorbet

MJEtTfcAc1sUyg4hEB9r0g.text: We were in the area and I was feeling on a snack and saw some of my Yelp friends check into the Crepe Shack so I decided to get crepe-y and be creepy.   I didn't find my friends, but I found some treats to fill in the need for a afternoon snack.   I got the East Meets West: red bean, mochi bits, condensed milk and green tea ice cream. I forgot how messy Japanese crepes was, but it was fun eating it. The flavors all went really well together and the crepe was good. It's a little less crisp than some of the crepe places I like (like Sophies in SFO), but good flavor and chewy.  The BF is more of a waffle person so he got a Bananas Foster: bananas, cinnamon powder, caramel, whip cream, ice cream. It was good toppings, but since they are using the crepe batter the texture is less than ideal. It was dense and wasn't crispy enough. The BF thinks next time he will order a crepe instead since that wasn't what he looks for in a waffle.   The staff is really friendly. The owner was the one who rang us up and saw my Yelp check-in offer and asked about how often I used it, asked what I thought of the crepe, etc. Seems like the type of owner who is responsive to customers feedback. They're fairly new, but it seems they are getting into a groove.  We live way across town, but definitely a place I can see myself stopping by again when we're in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Bananas Foster Waffle
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. East Meets West

7WIV6oG0JzYym8W5_hi5tQ.text: Moved down to Reno a few weeks ago and heard this place through some friends. They had a large menu consisting of different types of crepes and waffles. I couldn't decide on which crepe to try so I actually had a custom made crepe with bananas, strawberries, blackberries, cheesecake bits, and vanilla ice cream. It was sooo yummy!! I usually don't like ridiculously sweet desserts, but this was perfect. The owners were really friendly too. They explained the concept of the Japanese style crepe as soon as I came in. They also made me an ice coffee, which wasn't on the menu.    I would definitely come back for an evening snack/ dessert. Highly recommend this place!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Custom Crepe

gmal0ae49X5jJB5guy2oXw.text: After a few months, I finally got to come here to eat my free waffle. And it was pretty darn good. Nice crunch on the outer crust while soft and fluffy inside, which is exactly what I'm looking for in a waffle. It also came with softened butter, syrup, and powdered sugar! Sandra also offered whipped cream, but I opted not to so I could focus on the waffle. If you can't decide between the crepes and waffle, I would still go with the crepe just because I haven't tried any as good as here! I would of given the waffle 4 stars, but Sandra and her boyfriend are so friendly, so 5 stars again!

yGDgH4NvGU0QYfjUhEMfPg.text: My pregnant sister was craving crepes for the longest & 1 of our friends told us about this place so we decided to check it out after dinner. As I came in, I smelled something wonderful & sweet. Even though I was kind of full from eating at Montesano's Italian Eateria nearby, my stomach got excited again & my mouth started watering w/ the aroma. I got such a bad sweet tooth.  The place was so clean & had that cute modern look. Very friendly staff. Very reasonably priced. There were so many options on the menu. Everything sounded good. We ended w/ the Cookie Monster, Banana Foster & the Elvis crepes w/ vanilla ice cream. AMAZING!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! The cookie monster was my favorite. It was like eating that Half Baked ice cream by Ben & Jerry's but 100x's better. OMFG! I seriously want to come back again today. I'm in love. It's my first time having a crepe in shape of a cone w/ ice cream. I can't believe I've been missing out all this time. So thankful for my sister's pregnancy cravings. Next time I'm going to try either the Rebel or Tickle me Berry w/ the green tea ice cream. The Maui Fever sounds good too. I'm so excited for my next visit!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States

3qYviPERYbk44565H_u7hA.text: The crepe batter was bland and not on the crispy side. The rating is purely due to the subpar batter. Crepes are one of my favorite desserts of all time, so the three star rating might be a little harsh. But I was just so disappointed that I am sure I won't be making the trip out there again. Other than the blah-ness of the crepes, everything else was good. The portion sizes were decent, the space was open and very clean. The staff was very friendly and the ambiance was bright and inviting. FYI: The waffle batter was better than the crepe's.

9Bs6lQdTillThJdFfc8wwQ.text: REALLLLLLY!!!! Finally!  Japanese style crepes in Vegas?!?!?  For those of you who are so loveable that you have read my reviews in other states, you know I have a thing for hand held crepes.  My favorite place is Sophie's in San Francisco's Japantown, a place I went daily on my most recent Bay Area vacation (I posted a pic with my review of my eating the coveted green tea ice cream red bean paste matcha sauce crepe).  Then last summer in Seattle, I made my co-vacationers go to a mall just so I could try Unicone.  Needless to say, I had no idea based on the picture on yelp that the crepes would be hand held.  I just went because I knew it would at least smell good in a place that makes crepes and waffles!  Heading in there today, I learned that Crepe Shack opened 3 days ago.  Owner Li is a young entrepreneur with a big colorful space and lots of restaurant experience.  We talked at length about the business idea, his support of other new businesses and food trucks, and sushi (because we all love it mmm).  He is working out supplier issues so more toppings and ice cream flavors are to come, but for now, there is still a great selection.  I enjoyed a crepe with fresh strawberries and kiwi, shredded coconut, and almonds.  It was a really good treat, sweet and tasted healthy.  Li told me the batter is meant to taste fortune-cookie-esque, and it did.  This is a really fun place for a "healthy sweet tooth" craving.  If you track me down at the Yelp Seats kickoff on Tuesday, Li gave me a stack of 15% off cards that I can hand out!  Bon appetit!

hWDG2ghP4CgFh1FGrClsaw.text: Crepes are soo good !!! Definatly coming back

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Bomb !

_d9XSxxBmJx3vZUq833a8Q.text: I love everything about this place! Very good Japanese crepes, waffles, fresh fruits, clean, and the staff are very friendly and alert! They have a big selection of fruit combinations, and non fruit combos that goes very well together.

SGtAAXZR-jDGKNL_aFBBJQ.text: Yummy!!  I went here 2 weeks ago and it was really good.  Customer Service was excellent.  Way to go guys!  I had the Crepe  with cheesecake bites, ice cream and berries.  I have never had a Japanese Crepe before and they now have a fan.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States

g7AgHBqIDjOluMt8IfLidg.text: Cool and adventurous!  If you like something different and fun, try this place out.  1.  Crepe - Enjoy the story of how the crepe is made and the freshness as it is created right in front of you.  2.  Fillings - Watch as they put the freshest possible fillings into your crepe.  3.  Fun - The team doing this seem to have a lot of fun and are totally committed to the experience!  The experience and hip ambiance is the key to this rating!  The crepes were okay, but I am just not a big fan in general, so don't take my word for the taste side.....

Banana, Strawberry, warm Nutella and one scoop of ice cream. Holy Jesus! The Crepe is made to perfection, just the right amount of thinness, just the right size to where you don't feel like going into a state of dessert-coma, and the ice cream is perfectly sweet, not too rich, giving your sweet tooth the capacity to handle the entire crepe!   The staff is amazing, always a clean establishment and don't forget to check in on Yelp for 10% off your purchase!

VzWb9aFOR0hJX83RNA6jFg.text: This place was unbelievably good.  Any crepe you want, savory or sweet.  Not to be missed.

ppAb2XlSA46CrKObg41e9w.text: Waffles, waffles, waffles! Super addictive! My family and I were only staying in the Vegas area for a couple of weeks but we were here almost every day. Every time we visited, the place was very clean and the staff- very friendly.   Whether it was crepes and ice cream, waffles and ice cream, scoops of ice cream, or a yogurt parfait, there was satisfaction in every bite! I first had the East Meets West waffle which came with red bean paste, mochi bites, condensed milk, syrup, whipped cream and my choice of green tea ice cream. It looked incredible and tasted so dreamy. Another time, I had the Rebel Special waffle with bananas, strawberries, Nutella, syrup, whipped cream and my choice of chocolate ice cream. This was a real classic, on steroids!!!   Their yogurt parfaits have just the right balance of sweet and sour with a whole lotta freshness while their cone crepes are made super thin as the perfect vessel for ice cream and other heavenly goodness. Everything here's waffley good!  TIPS: **Plenty of parking in a shared lot **Wheelchair accessible **Gender-neutral restroom **Awards punch card available - buy 10 items, get the 11th free

NxDL8DpjkNu41NhS_jf57w.text: For the first time experience, it was a great location and great item concepts. That will definitely be a stop my next time in Vegas.

KNvX_PGSBfp_KGtIAmUS5A.text: Ended up here because my daughter was craving for crepes. The place is well kept and it looks like they pay attention to cleanliness. There's plenty of seating and definitely room for a busy day without feeling crowded. Definitely worth the a shot if you're into sweet desserts. The Thriftys ice cream is also a nice touch to know that there's something everyone is (or at least should be) familiar with. Tuesday's is $1 scoops so scoop away.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. She was too excited to take a pic before she started eating.

GC2yJUPSJP_Dnax2HiOGQw.text: Crepe Shack & Waffles is always an option for us when we're looking for dessert or something sweet. The crepes and waffles are executed consistently every time we've come in and with the infinite combinations, they'll always be something to find that's pleasing.  Located on the southwest corner of Eastern and Coronado, it's easy to find and you'll enter a spacious area with plenty of seating inside and a few tables outside. The menu consists of combinations that you can choose to have a freshly made crepe or a waffle as your vehicle to hold your toppings. I prefer the waffle over the crepe for the added texture factor and less messy factor. Top it off with a scoop of Thrifty's ice cream, and you're golden.  I've tried about three or four of the creations and I really like the Camp Out Smore topped with a scoop of chocolate malt crunch which is my favorite Thrifty flavor. The chocolate flavors with the crunchy waffle and graham crackers with the sweetness of the whipped cream and marshmallows just goes together well with me. The rest of the family usually goes for crepes with some kind of fresh fruit combination.  Prices are fair and depending on how much you add on, a crepe or waffle will run you between $5-$7. We've never really had any issues with service as the employees are willing to help you out if it's your first time or answer any questions. They've got the technique pretty down pat and can bust out a waffle or crepe in a couple of minutes. If you choose to hang out, you can grab a board game whoop everyone's butt in Sorry just like I did.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Camp out smore waffle: marshmallow, graham cracker, chocolate syrup, with chocolate malted crunch ice cream
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Guess who was yellow?
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Deluxe PBJ crepe: banana, peanut butter, strawberry jelly, with chocolate malted crunch ice cream

85d_gDZrzQrAy3BoKe2Wog.text: One of my favorite Crepe & Waffle places in all of Henderson. Stopped in after visiting Level Ten Salon a couple of doors down. The last time I was here was five years ago so I don't remember what I had then. It was definitely worth coming back to try this place again. They had just announced the limited edition Pumpkin Spice Crepe not too long ago. We thought it would taste average but it was extremely sweet. I tried the Camp Smore Crepe, which was packed with marshmallows and graham crackers. If you like Crepes, then this is the place for you. Check it out.

FjHXLyWQuNe4HxG7PSldvA.text: My guy was having a sweet tooth, and on a Sunday night this place was actually open fairly late, so we thought to finally try it out.   They have a large selection of different flavor combinations, but you can also customize your own.  We shared the rebel which had strawberry, bananas, whipped cream and nutella with an ice cream of our choice (we picked vanilla) wrapped inside a crepe that was folded into a cone shape.  On its own the ice cream is nothing special, but when mixed with everything else it becomes something very yummy.  The nutella made it something I would crave again because nutella is basically liquid crack.  I actually would ask for them to add extra nutella next time because they were a little light on the application of it.    The man behind the counter was very patient and helpful, and they made it quickly after we put our order in.  If it is your first time you can get 10 percent off with a yelp check in. There is a good amount of seating inside, but we took ours to go.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. The rebel

lLpNdlpfjMlJ96gQz6gJLg.text: Amazing crepe, friendly staff, great ice-cream, but the shop is a bit dirty every time we visit.  Whenever we are in Henderson, we stop by to grab a crepe and always end up thinking of getting a second serving. A bit different kind of crepe compared to that of French or Japanese, and that is actually refreshing.  I hope they open one close to mid Las Vegas than all the way out in Henderson!

ebagtsq4xbhl7nOvjvcfVg.text: Upon entering this place, the aroma is amazing. The smell of batter and cooked crepes encompasses you and it's delightful. The staff is friendly and the establishment is quite big and a good area to study or catch up with friends as you enjoy your crepe.   Their crepes are delectable. They are Japanese style crepes, where they are wrapped up like a cone and you eat it without utensils (but you can if you really need to). My personal favorite is the East Meets West; it is a crepe filled with red bean paste, mochi, and condensed milk and I like to get green tea ice cream and whipped cream on top. The red bean paste is tasty and smooth and is complemented by the chewiness of the mochi; the condensed milk adds a slight but subtle sweetness to the entire dessert.   Definitely recommend this place and will be coming back time and time again!
