dBoPyRh1lBiiSumltXRw7A.text: Came here on a hot summer day in Vegas and was craving some good 'ole yummy ice cream. I saw the amazing reviews on Yelp and was excited to try this place. When I got here, the place was empty. We were the only ones here! For a place with such great reviews, I'm surprised there was no one here.   This Korean guy came out to take our order. I have to say the customer service was definitely lacking. He did not look enthusiastic at all. He just stood there while we were trying to figure out what to order. He didn't really make suggestions or offer any "popular" menu items. He just stood there and stared at us. It was kinda awkward. Once we finally ordered, I was surprised at how expensive it was. But I figured, it must be good!   Once the waffle cones and crepe cones came out, I was a bit disappointed that my order didn't look like the one pictured on the screen. It looked so nice and tempting on the display, but in person, the toppings were lacking and not as appealing. The crepe was unique and I liked it as a cone, but it was soft, not crispy. The ice cream was...well, ice cream. Nothing too special. It's definitely not what I'd thought it would be from reading the reviews!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Crepe and waffle cones

MlcYNTaiHIJCjZkjzstodQ.text: I often feel like a latecomer to some places, but I don't mind having missed out as long as they're good. This one was.  Crepe Shack & Waffles is a Henderson dessert shop (sorry, savory food fans) that has been raved about by at least some of my buddies. It still took me years to check it out for whatever reason. Demonstrating a phenomenon that I've seen at many sweet stops, these guys were really busy tonight within the final half hour before closing. I'm sure the weather and the end of the school year factor played big parts, but maybe there was some spillover from a nearby dessert shop that had an unbelievably huge response to its free ice cream sandwich promo. My friend and I were in that latter group.  Neither of us were actually feeling too hungry, so we agreed to share a crepe ($5.50), although in hindsight a waffle ($6.95) would have been easier to split. We ended up taking turns holding the crepe and biting into it, which I suppose is how they want you to eat it (plus or minus the sharing). Maybe I should get tested for cooties soon.  Anyway, our choice was the strawberry sensation, which comes with slices of strawberry, little cubes of cheesecake, strawberry syrup, and a choice of ice cream (we did chocolate malted krunch, one of the flavors of the Thrifty ice cream carried here) and whipped cream (we skipped this). The crepe was thin and chewy, so props for cooking it right despite the pressure during the rush and the likely fatigue at the end of the shift. The strawberry was fresh. The cheesecake cubes were fun. The syrup was standard. The ice cream was as good as you'd expect.  I enjoyed Crepe Shack & Waffles, and it was nice to check another place off my seemingly endless list of yet-to-be-visited food places. It seemed a tad pricey, but I'll definitely consider returning for a delicious dessert if I'm in the area for restaurants or whatnot in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Strawberry Sensation crepe ($5.50) with chocolate malted krunch Thrifty ice cream, but no whipped cream

95jQ4xUI-3dBT2NxkXd2OA.text: What a lucky find to stumble upon before having dinner at Duzan next door. While we had dinner we looked up the menu and found that the crepes are Japanese style. I'm glad that I knew this going in since Japanese crepes and French crepes are a bit different. Both are good!  The menu is large for a shop specializing in crepes and waffles. There are about 20 flavor combinations that combine fruits, sauces, nuts, and other ingredients for yummy combinations. These combinations can be put inside of a crepe or on top of a waffle. Every combination includes a scoop of ice cream and there are about 20 Thrifty ice cream flavors to choose from. For people that are more creative there is also an option to create your own from the ingredients list. The shop also offers ice cream scoops, sundaes, shakes, and floats. Everyone in the group will find a sweet treat to enjoy here.  I had the Camp Out S'more in a Crepe with Coffee Ice Cream. The crepe is folded like an ice cream cone to hold all of the toppings which makes it easy to enjoy. The crepe looks hard in the photo, but is actually tender and chewy. Somehow it holds everything in, but has a very nice texture.   My husband had the Cookie Monster on a Waffle with Cookie n Cream Ice Cream. He said it was one of the best desserts he's ever had. I tasted it and agreed that the combination was delicious. The peanut butter, Oreo, and cookie dough combination on the waffle was fantastic.  The shop is large and open with many seats available. There are even board games available for those that want to hang out for awhile.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Cookie Monster on a waffle.
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Camp Out S&#39;more in a crepe.

Best thing is that they serve Thrifty ice! yes they have the chocolate malted crunch!  Just like someone said it would be good if they crisp'd up the crepe and waffles a lil bit  Overall, everything is fresh and tasty.

qVZtG__H2VKPuD5dbDC1ZQ.text: I can't believe it took me so long to find this place!  I visited this place in the mood for a sweet treat and that is exactly what I got.  This was my first "Japanese style crepe" and it certainly won't be my last.  I ordered the Bananas Foster (brown sugar, cinnamon, banana and caramel) with vanilla ice cream that was recommended to me by the staff.  I enjoyed it so much that the second time I visited, I ordered the same thing.   I was impressed that the young staff working there seemed so interested and invested in their jobs. They were very friendly and took the time to explain the menu, answer any questions and make recommendations.  So happy to have found a new and interesting place to take my out of town guests to. Looking forward to returning and trying some other favors and perhaps a waffle.

fz7rqjOJKHwHgvTdw2bKaA.text: Been here twice now and I plan on coming more often. I hope this place never goes out of business cuz I might have to start a riot :/

bXW219-0O2zWdVLVA0SHiQ.text: Really now, I can't rave anymore on how amazing this place is. Instead, I've just gotten to the point where I insist on taking away everyone's "Crepe Virginity", and in turn, they all become just as obsessed as I do. In the past two weeks, I have convinced at least 80 percent of my coworkers to try Crepe Shack, and all of them have loved it as much as I do. Truly, what's not to love?  After two months of being home and going to the Crepe Shack on a bi-weekly basis, I still can find no fault in their crepes. Still fluffy, delicious, and guilt-free with that serving of fruit (which seems to get larger every time I come in), crepes are the new cupcake, and with Crepe Shack around, I hope that it is a culinary endeavor that will never die out. I've tried to branch out and try most of the crepes, but I always stick with my favorites: Tickle Me Berry and Make Me Swirl.   The best part are the owners and staff - so incredibly friendly. It always makes me smile when an establishment recites your order as your approach the register - done so many times when I'm with my friends with their dead-set orders. A lot of times, I tend to loiter Crepe Shack for an hour after the crepes are gone, but I never receive a dirty glance or any sort of discomfort for it.   I have so much love for Crepe Shack - it is perhaps one of the best things to happen to Vegas ever since I left for school. When I go back, I know that this will be the one place I will miss the most.

Qg-geCJz1a243BMkug0oow.text: Took a trip out to San Francisco and had the most amazing crepes in J-town. We were really craving some crepes so we decided to try this place. Overall, good stuff here but not like the ones that we had in San Fran. This crepe was a bit more chewy and they also ran out of the some of things that I wanted with my crepe. Cool concept though. They make a crepe and then put your choice of ice cream and toppings into that crepe which they roll into a cone. Good for that dessert craving!

uKI35NlK2Ekot-7Dhyx24A.text: Crepes.....I LOVE crepes. Now this is a different kind of crepe that I've never had before. Japanese style crepes are a "fortune cookie" flavored crepe. We came here on a Sunday and it was pouring! Rain won't stop us foodies! Since we were full from a 4th of July party we decided to share one crepe which proved to be more than enough for the two of us. I ordered the Rebel Special without ice cream, which meant that I got more fruit. I really liked the crepe itself without all the filling.....which you can actually order! Next time I'll order my own crepe with the fillings that I want. A pretty cool concept and pretty good dessert.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. rebel special no ice cream

6yVDrIrhUaQd73DOvxC82w.text: I had a groupon for this place and my husband and i stopped in one night. They had a nice size crowd in there so I figured we were in for a good desert. I ordered the crepe and ice cream and my husband just ordered pistacio ice cream. I got mine and there was no ice cream and they gave me his in a cup. I had to go back up and advise my ice cream was missing, I gues they guy thought i was ordering a palin crepe with ice cream to the side which is odd since my flavor and my husbands was different. The did fix it at no charge which i thought was nice. I think due to the volume maybe that was the cause of the mistake. I would recomend this place the food is good and you get to see them make the crepe's in front of you.

1EW2jVju3hXn4s3BJo8psA.text: I love crepes and was super excited to try out the Crepe Shack & Waffles. I've never had Japanese style crepes before and I'm definitely hooked! They also have waffles and ice cream sandwiches (which looked super yummy). Although there were so many yummy options to choose from, I ended up getting the daily special crepe which had nutella *mmm*, blueberries, and strawberries (with a scoop of vanilla ice cream :)   The store is very clean with lots of seating. Employees were very nice, friendly, and helpful with recommendations when ordering. They also have plenty of bottled beverages including my favorite, Jones Soda!   Bottom line, I'd definitely recommend checking them out, you'll be a fan!

XCWdMH67V1ScREyO62nNwg.text: Pretty tasty. Not quite the same as having a crepe in Paris, but not bad either. I had the 'East Meets West' crepe and added green tea ice cream. I'm a big fan of Asian flavors, and this crepe hit the spot. My crepe was wrapped in red bean paste, covered in mochi, and topped with condensed milk. Really good stuff and a friendly staff! I appreciated the 10% off with check in as well.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. &#39;East Meets West&#39; crepe with green tea ice cream.

FfaQTaP6gF1_glOtL3B_TQ.text: We happened to be in the neighborhood and decided to try this place.  I got the "Rock in the Road", made waffle style.  This was choice of ice cream, almonds, marshmallows, and white chocolate syrup, served on top of a waffle. Soooo good!    the waffle was thick and had a little crisp to the outside, and the flavors of the marshmallows with the syrup and waffle was so good!   The menu here is exciting, a unique way to serve ice cream.  I know we'll be back to try more.

IZFn68ucenzQ1QnJlVdVLw.text: I picked this place for one of my last hurrah treats before summer dieting begins. Oh to be a naturally thin person so I could eat here every day (ok I'd settle for once a week!).   We tried a waffle and a crepe. Both were wonderful. We customized them to our own tastes (I got bananas, oreos, caramel and vanilla ice cream in a crepe and the husband got birthday cake ice cream and brownies on a waffle). Both were cooked to order and utterly delicious.   Yay for birthday cake ice cream, tons of beautiful fresh fruit, and a nice mixture of conventional and creative toppings. The owners were friendly and service was quick. I will be back once my bikini days are behind me !

KwwkC4nRrnpoinMXGjllZQ.text: Headed over to Crepe Shack & Waffles after an absolutely miserable dinner down the street.  After reading the reviews on Yelp we desperately needed something to put a smile on our faces.  After walking in I noticed the simplicity of interior of the place.  We stared at the electronic menu and were immediately asked if we had been there before by an attentive employee.  She briefed us on what we could expect.  I ordered up "The Elvis" which consisted of ice cream, peanut butter, bananas with honey.  I then sat back and enjoyed the symphony of movement behind the counter.    One employee poured the crepe batter on a round griddle and then spun the mixture around as if she was raking a zen garden.  The other employee cut and began dicing to perfection my banana just I had seen him do with the other fruits before mine.  Once all the ingredients were placed together the crepe was then rolled into the shape of a cone.  Being the messy eater that I am I requested a fork and one was produced from behind the counter.  Even thought the preparation may be slow, I think that deliberate is a more appropriate term.  The presentation is simply elegant and the taste was pretty damn good.  It not a question of if I will return it's only a matter of when.....and wether I decided to make a next crepe cone a healthy one.

a_ipOQPlcJN1DMJ1SGkF2g.text: Tried the Tickle Me Berry w/ Birthday Cake Ice Cream. Crepe flavor was ok/average. Berries were fresh. Ice cream was fun and delicious. Can't beat the price. The worker was very hardworking.

KEXw3iDa8vzOHv8pxtRbNw.text: Boring. That's about it. I don't have much of a sweet tooth, so I might hold an impassive attitude. My daughter got a Nutella and strawberry crepe, hubby got a Nutella and banana and I had the coffee ice cream/mocha crepe. None were overly spectacular. The decor is pretty basic and plain. They do have just Thrifty ice cream if you are looking for that instead of a crepe experience.  The staff was very nice though.

1LM-aNSoG12lpzHZOpy4Dg.text: I love this place! It gets filled with teeny boppers once in a while, but don't let that bother you. After all, you come for the crepes and not to see teen infestation at the place. The place is decorated well and the high ceilings is what made the place look so much bigger than it actually is. The pop of colors on the walls definitely adds to the clean look and simplicity of the place, which for me, is great. The crepes are always made fresh and fast which I like because not everyone has the time to stay to eat and chat.   For me, I get my crepe and head on out the door. If you plan on staying and eating your crepes, you can play board games like Uno, Battleship, and they also have Jenga. Beware: the games are sticky because people like to eat and play at the same time!  Definitely a great place to visit! They need to open up a second location ASAP!

CJ-GyQvKYU-ip4GjiSec1w.text: This is my most favorite "Shack" in town! Crepe Shack and Waffles is a fun, funky little whole in the wall eatery. When you first walk in the doors you are welcomed to bright walls and the smell of what seems to be fresh baked cake....but, once you look deeper you realize that beautiful aroma is coming from the freshly made Crepes. SO DELICIOUS!  If you do not want to be disappointed, then order what I ordered. It was amazing! I got the Rebel Crepe (Bananna, Strawberries and Nutella) with birthday cake ice cream and fresh whip cream. OMG- It was so good that I already know what I am going to be craving whenever I get pregnant, or not...lol .Either way, these crepes mean business.  Overall this is the kind of place you check out at least once. Its pretty yummy and a unique way to hit that sweet spot from time to time. In my opinion, there is really nothing crepey about this place, its all good to me!

-e8BNMiy_YAPgxYSkpOldg.text: I have trusted Yelp a lot so tried.  Really?? I could not think this place is great ;; Nothing special.  Not many toppings;; Also, I do not like their 'Tip-pushing' card reader. It was very unpleasant  experience to be asked pay tips before I get my food. I will not go there again.

x0TTvL9TjvjiRyyjcFP7ag.text: This place is was so good. Nice customer service and environment. Simple but fun. The spin on traditional crepes and ice cream cone style is a great idea. We will definitely be back. Had a crepe today looking forward to trying the waffles next time.

MZQJJI3rQC17fJegUhD4Pw.text: Love love love it!!!! I've had 2 crepes so far that have included strawberries,banana, peanut butter and vanilla yogurt. The combo was mouth watering! Tonight I'm trying the cookie monster with added raspberries and raspberry sherbet. Wow was this good. But a bad idea to eat this in place of dinner because I was left with a sugar high and a tummy ache. Next time I'll share this one and have it as desert. Definitely an awesome eat though. I crave this place literally everyday that I have to fight myself not to drive anywhere near the intersection. Everyone there is so nice and patiently waits while you contemplate what to order since there are soo many choices.  TIP: Use your yelp check-in offers and look out for coupons in the mail.

DdaMqFEFsgafAszv5I6fzg.text: 3 1/2 stars. This place isn't bad. Never had a crepe wrapped up like this and it was just ok to me. Definitely prefer the French style better, you get more of the crepe flavor. This style, the crepe is more to hold the ice cream and whatever else you order in. The waffle was pretty solid. I'd definitely order the waffle over the crepe. What I thought was cool was that they've a small selection of old-school board games on a shelf so they obviously don't mind people hanging out there for a bit.

LNLQCPCH5tUvkgU4v-btwg.text: My favorite place for dessert! Friendly staff

rxw5Uq0HxqHVjtvHUDyYTg.text: Awesome fresh crepes & waffles made to order. The staff use seasonal fruit & toppings, fresh whipped creme & the ice cream is terrific too. The staff are customer service oriented, always welcoming with a smile. What more could you ask for?

zCH_Q4XcNsigEgJVvWTfdw.text: soooooo delicious ... the crepe and ice cream combination is amazing ... thrifty ice cream is of course delicious but with toppings, whip cream and thrown inside a crepe .. wow perfectjon !!!! Such a fun and friendly place too and i love their shirts "id eat it .." !!!!  I had the banana cheesecake pie with chocolate ice cream wow wow wow !!!!!

v2gNNR84zyf_3GoKw-12Ng.text: It's at the end of the shopping center where trader joes is. Pretty big place & friendly service. I had the "mix" which had strawberry, bananas, and kiwis (with strawberry ice-cream). It's like a crepe burrito but shaped more like an ice cream cone. It's quite good and mad props for having mexican coke with real sugar. Go ahead and drop by; I don't think you'll be disappointed.

AacDa-EahPBIa5Z3y-uCAA.text: Best waffles I've ever had. The gf and I try to go there once a week.

74QxHD5mvq8y_Rj7UekPnQ.text: We went back last night, the place was jumpin' busy and the staff handled it, no prob. We were greeted and welcomed back when we walked in, and hey, that's always nice, right? Our crepes were delicious again! Kid one got the Camp Out S'more with coffee ice cream and loved it. Kid two got the Rebel Special with vanilla ice cream. I assume she liked it because I never saw her eat it. Poof! Gone.  I had the Make Me Swirl with raspberry sorbet (YEA!!!), and it was divine! It's going to be hard to stay away! :)

Goxnrf7YkBU0MVPesErZWA.text: We were not sure what to expect from the Crepe Shack but we decided to give it a shot. SO glad we did! The crepe and the waffle were spectacular. Bananas, ice cream, strawberries, almonds, YUM! I know that I will be back!

SvhERHgf3mWk73xuLeQlRA.text: I went there because of the great reviews on Yelp. We ordered two crepes. Yes, you get fresh fruit pieces, and a scoop of ice cream or frozen yogurt. It's a quick and delightful snack. But the crepes seemed undercooked. The color of the crepe was very pale. Plus, it's not crispy at all. I was disappointed. It's just ok.

ltcw7fofy1na58VRFTIItQ.text: I've been a crepe lover forever! Especially french style crepes, but as soon as I found out they were japanese style, I was a little disappointed, considering I'm french!.  But I had recently tried them in California, so I was open to what Vegas had to offer. I recently just moved from Beverly Hills so I was happy when I found a crepe place at my convenience. I stopped by Crepe Shack & Waffles on thursday and can I just say that those crepes are to die for! It's one of my new favorite dessert places. Yogurtland doesn't even compare! I will definitely be back for more. The guy at the cashier was not only cute but very helpful when I was trying to decide what to order. I definitely recommend creating your own masterpiece, so that you can have whatever you want! My friend got the Rebel Special which was also very good! People!!! don't knock the japanese crepe, till you try it. Also realize that you can get an entire meal/dessert out of one crepe and it doesn't have to be savory!!! Definitely worth the price they charge, i actually think they should be more expensive considering the quality, service and location.  KEEP DOING WHAT YOU'RE DOING! I LOVE THOSEEE CREPES!~

2SJT1mzuVUi7hxJ_mfsXKA.text: My favorite dessert place in town. The waffles are amazing. Everything is fresh not overly sweet just very good. The owners are supper nice.

_EZ8u1uXvh2bvOx6_YyyHQ.text: Was in the mood for waffles and found this place on Yelp. Decided it was a must try based on the reviews. Wow, did not disappoint! Had the bananas foster waffle with a scoop of birthday cake ice cream, good stuff! Staff is very friendly and helpful especially if it's your first time.

W5tA45s_RwM-wbGz_-OX9Q.text: This place is great! I really enjoyed the crepe and the staff were very friendly. I would give it five stars if they offered sorbet or another non-dairy frozen alternative. Overall though, I enjoyed my crepe and will return.

axqgI80wN_-3zo1BD_tOzw.text: Place is great, i just wish we can stack four to five waffles together and   make it into a castle for fat people like me! Healthy and yummy.

woEO7KUZRKJsQy5OF2xgCQ.text: The waffles here are very good, and you can load them up with lots of fruits!

2t0JvBWDiuJZEjjyH4XUFA.text: We had the classic waffle with cheesecake bites, nutella and granola...was yummers! Also had the crepe Banana Foster with vanilla ice cream...good.  The crepe was good (but I like mines with a more eggy taste).  Try it or one of their signature waffles (with toppings galore), you won't be disappointed.

A9OD87--FrvlREGPrOe09A.text: It's a really big and quiet place, the crepes were made just like i was used to, with nutella. Their crepes were pretty good, not the best, but still pretty good.

HbyWLWi0y86vvEmqPSXJrA.text: Addicted to this place! Brought my whole family here and they have yet to make me look bad! Considering I live in Aliante area and this is in Henderson should yell people something! I skip 5 other places to come here! I always make my own and always with ice cream...

jYV8dlMvzNwxQ9pdeBdulQ.text: Rebel Sensation crepe was very tasty! Good service and friendly staff. We'll be back.

jDw-cbsUaJRAJSFeDQatcw.text: As good as it gets for an afternoon sugar fix! :)

eyRXPBmPn00EY1RnRvt7dg.text: All right, so this place is trying to go with the Japanese Crepe style ... well i lived in Japan for almost 10 years so I am going to critique this to the best of my knowledge and experience. Crepes (especially japanese style that is everywhere around Tokyo) was one of my favorite desserts as a child, so when I went there I was so excited that someone finally started a similar business!  First off good job on the selections, I like the fact that they have lots of choices of ice cream and toppings/extras. Kind of like all the yogurt places but it definitely works for this also. But the CREPE!!! the crepe is my favorite part, but you have not come up to my standards. The crepe has no flavor but just white.. what .. flour? there's no brown ish carmel color of cooked dough with the egg batter taste. The crepe is .. too sad. So upset i was that when i go, i just get the waffles. I'm not the expert in waffles so it was a bit better than crepes. but even the waffles are a bit plain... the waffle ice cream sandwich at the "LunchBox" is Way better.. Sorry! And I think the decorative manner of the food still needs a bit work with nutella and peanutbutter coming out as tubes looking like tooth paste. haha. But as a customer, as long as you know what toppings goes well with what type of ice cream, you're in it for a treat. I'll go back even if its not as good as the ones in Japan.  I gave three stars because of the batter for crepe, waffles, style of food presentation, and okay service.

ImQJhPz-y7iXM3Ns8-rkTA.text: great customer service. Had a classic-tasted quite good.

stzNR9W8t8STliNiJQ-ZLQ.text: Mind blowingly good! We made the short drive from Las Vegas to eat here. We didn't know it wasn't classical French crepes but were really plesantly surprised with this Japanese alternative. They serve them like soft ice cream cones where the yummy ingredients are put inside. The fruit was so delicious and the yougurt was really tasty. I had chesecake bits in mine and wished I had one of these joints in my area. Eating breakfast there really made my day!!!!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Spectacular creation!!! Franchise this please!

zT0atvynxQ_aAFxqqCcm5w.text: We love the Crepe Shack--we've been going there for years. My husband always gets the Bananas Foster crepe. I keep trying different ones, but I always come back to my favorite: The Elvis. The people who work there are super friendly, fast and efficient, and are always eager to please. They also have a punch card (buy 10, get one free). It's a nice place to eat on the way to Trader Joe's (they're in the same mall). We've gone late at night after a show for a snack, but mostly go around lunch time. Any time of day, they taste great. I can't say enough nice things about these guys and their crepes!

co4ZKJ1OURrudFP9U9I4Vw.text: I've loved crepes ever since I ate one from a street vendor in Paris.  The lightness, the fluffyness, the myriad of options to put on top or in it.  Delectable.  The shop is pretty minimal, with pastels on the wall and menus on flatscreens.  I think people are tired of climbing up on ladders to change prices.  You can make your own crepe (with high number of combinations possible), or pick one of the combos.  I'm not a fan of many berries, so I partook in the Classic with a scoop of Green Tea ice cream.  Keep in mind that crepes do take a while to come out, but it's being made right in front of you: the batter is spread and cooked, the fruit is peeled and chopped, the ice cream is scooped, and the entire thing rolled up in a cone.  It's placed in a paper cone as well, but keep in mind it's a warm treat with ice cream in it.  Melt will happen.  Although I don't agree with David S that the crepe made me jizz in my pants, it was wholesomely good.  If you've never had green tea ice cream before, you're missing out.  It's vaguely sweet, with the undertone of tea that contrasts the sweet with its slight bitterness.  The classic already had nutella and bananas in it, so that's enough sweet for me.  Check in on Yelp and you will get 10% off, but be kind and drop at least that much in the tip jar.  The folks that work here are very warm and friendly, and it's not the easiest thing to make.  Never had a waffle here, but why would you have one when you can get a crepe?!  What's your cost for this exotic French treat? 5. 5 dollar.  5 dollar footlong.  It's ca-ca-ca-catching on.

8SWPI9mFZrIzxgIDKqxFIw.text: Super impressed!  The food was delicious, the staff was friendly, and the place is very clean.  I'd never experienced Japanese crepes before, and I'm pleased to report I have a new favorite.  Not so heavy as to make you stuffed, but sweet enough to satisfy.  I had the Elvis, which is a crepe with banana, peanut butter, and ice cream.  I also tried the yogurt parfait, which was well done, and I got to pick my fruits, which I liked.  It's great to have something new and different in my neighborhood.  Also, they stay open late, so check them out!

eWi6TneA8IDIDJjFvWd8qg.text: Yummy! Portions are huge! It's not really the traditional crepe you'd think of though. Instead, it's kind of like frozen yogurt toppings/preparation

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. The Splits???

HcjOb_Ad2DqiP5h4_NIU4g.text: Always a pleasure to hang out here after school with my friends. With plenty of board games and creeps sweeter than Kirby on a sugar rush, this place will keep friends and family entertained, too! The workers are friendly, as well as the manager. Also! If you subscribe to their text message service, you can keep up with special deals that they make on the fly!

WHP7jCEKSDMHp-7Kv5JAdQ.text: Went here last weekend and got an original waffle w/ nutella, bananas and almonds. It was really yummy!  Everyone in my group got an different type and all though they were yum-0!  The place had fairly good foot traffic which was awesome considering it is a locally owned place. the only thing i thought was weird is they have real plates but plastic utensils.  Ill be back and have told my coworkers about it!

ntk8ql-0ykDrX09SgFCTow.text: This place definitely serves up some dessert crack at its best.  You just fein it and want that sugar kick!  The moment you walk in, you're taken away by the aroma's and smell of the crepes and waffles.  As for what to get, I'm sure everything is good.  It just depends if you're more in a savory dessert kick and want chocolate or if you're feeling fruity.  This place would get a solid 5 stars if they crisp'ed their crepes and waffles.  It would definitely add to the textural bite and overall dessert eating experience.  It also looks better appearance-wise..For those who have been to Genki Crepes in SF know what im talken about.  Since I dont know of any other Japanese Crepe places in Vegas, you should definitely check this place out.   THis place has lots of promis and I can see this in the Yelp Trending very soon if it is not already.

yE7CyNeBAsCudPXG_snyMA.text: Love this place crepes are ok but the waffles are fabulous. We take the kiddos every Wednesday for dollar scoop day  Their crepes are Japanese crepes so they are not on the sweet side but they are good . Topped with thriftys ice cream  yummy

1WsnlyliKk3ono5wZEHEBA.text: I had heard from David S. that their waffle batter had been revamped to be much lighter and crispier.  Since I was jonesing to fulfill my addiction anyway, Aziz B. and I made a stop on our way to the movies on a Friday night. I had just the plain waffle with some powdered sugar and a side of syrup. It was very crispy, light, and delicious--a huge change from the previous way it was made. Aziz B. had his waffle Berry Sensation style, and it was so good that I ate almost half of his. The fruit is a nice balance to the not-that-sweet, eggy taste of the waffle. I was told it's more of a Hong Kong style of waffle--referring to the eggier taste, which I think is great because I've honestly never had a Hong Kong style waffle before that night. My next visits will totally be waffle-fied, because I'm just as crazy about waffles as I am about crepes in cones!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. New waffle batter! Much crisper and lighter than before.

tQgal-JTeOxdtPIUrbInAw.text: This place is super convenient right in the same shipping center as trader joes. They have a bunch of games so you can hang out while you eat your delicious creeps. They are not your traditional, folded over served on a plate, crepe but rather you eat I'd like you're enjoying an ice cream cone. The ice cream options are great and there topping are cut fresh I order.

q-uqQLUHUEk0Erj7vmoPiw.text: After a big burger at Grind Burger, I had to take a big crepe.  So we went to this place that Elite Emily recommended. By this point I was good and ready for some tasty and delicious crepes. I was licking my lips looking at the choices, and Elite Emily and Hec were anxiously awaiting their crepes.  I selected the Camp Fire Smore crepe: a crepe with chocolate, marshmallows, and graham cracker bits. Nom nom no--- what? What did you ask me? What kind of ice cream did I want with that? Uh, chocolate malted crunch, I guess. Wow, crepes AND ice cream! Bonus!!!  But it wasn't until Elite Emily got her Strawberry Sensation that it hit me... the crepe was large, and rolled up like an ice cream cone, which was useful, since the ice cream sat in the middle, and the Smore part topped the ice cream. It was basically a giant, soft, ice cream cone.  Oh... that came out of nowhere.  So, apparently, that's the Japanese style of crepe. (Should have known, with Elite Emily's love of everything Asian.) I had no idea. I was expecting more along the lines of a breakfast crepe.  I mean, it was good, don't get me wrong.  I just really had looked forward to a breakfast-type crepe.  Oh, crepe... I miss you...

GKfrSNaLl9t3CXZGNHPh3w.text: This place couldn't be better. Fresh crepes, fruit, and Thrifty's ice cream for $1 a scoop! They're friendly, quick, and not expensive like the French crepe spots. I went in on a Friday night to find friends playing board games. Perfect for a low key hang out!

eA-mzaLZMsiiw1dqNJCgsA.text: My wife and I really enjoyed our waffles with bananas, strawberries, whipped cream, a scoop of ice cream, and syrup on the side!    I am also interested in trying something new - like the crepe, or a milkshake!  I would definitely go back for more!   They are open late!  We went at 9:30 PM on a Sunday night and they were open - it hit the spot!  Thank you!

LT7-Eoh53cGNUseNE1oC3g.text: Interesting to watch the crepe being made. Others in the family have made a big deal of this place, and it is ok.The dessert was ok but it is as much due to the uniqueness as anything else. 31 Flavors is better.   What bugged me was that the accent of the wait staff was so foreign thick that I couldn't understand the explanation of the 'system.'  So, I just ordered from the regular menu rather than making my own masterpiece. Making my own is what I will do should I ever venture off the beaten path again.

FpJKcGlWS5DBIgLmPb7HKg.text: This place is awesome.. The crepe I ordered was chocolotety.. Nutella, chocolate ice cream and chocolate toppings.. I loved it!  -Kyle, 7 years old

-ajk5VQG2D_z0LKfvuc8WA.text: This place was ok, but nothing to write home about, and certainly not worthy of a 5 star rating.  The quality of food, and price paid just aren't a match for me.  The service was good, but it just isn't a place I will return to.  There is much better out there.

v8T2Qx5iPwaczJbDZZ0JfA.text: First timer: hmm I really don't know what to say... Id like to say that I'm serious about waffles... Waffle here are mediocre at best... A little too crumbly for my taste, not really any texture, kinda like a fragile chip more like it... the ice cream sandwich was good BUT if you take  the time to go to LAPPERTS in California hotel, you can get an ice cream sandwich with double/triple the scoop, and a dinner plate size bigger cookie for the same exact price... I really don't understand the hype of this place?

ol2GGK8mbFN_RYF5TauCew.text: YUMMY! This place is amazing! Everyone go here! Soooooo good! I have never had anything here that isn't good!

soF_Zb-9kTcZbU329sTYNQ.text: I was craving ice cream big time, and my boyfriend and I actually stopped someplace else first. But it was like $5 for a single scoop of ice cream, so we left and stumbled upon Crepe Shack & Waffles.   I got the birthday cake ice cream with brownie bites, and it was exactly what I wanted. So creamy and soooooo good. He got something called the Elvis Crepe (?). He said he really liked the "guts" of the crepe, but the crepe itself was cardboard-y. Maybe it was cooked a bit too long? It wasn't moist enough. (He's also from France, so he's had the best of the best when it comes to crepes.)  The staff was so friendly and the service was quick. We'll definitely be back!

wSKCeoeZKgf4YpHvNWA99g.text: Tasty waffles, good music, clean and a few games in the corner... Good employees asked if we had been there before (nopes) and provided details about the crepes and more... We will return for sure!  I approve this message JKKUHL..

1FR-Gm9PmR9kbs_jfrErBg.text: Stumbled upon this place randomly and it is a pregnant lady's dream! Their crapes are amazing. I had such a hard time choosing one! My new favorite place

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Smores

TnPo4qG-wFcG-H-kt2mjNw.text: I ALWAYS go to Crepe Shack with my boyfriend lol I don't know why it took me this long to write a review, but this is absolutely one of the best crepe places in Vegas! We live 15 minutes away, and yes, we do drive all the way to Henderson just for their crepes because it's that good!  I've discovered Crepe Shack 3 years ago and I've been going here ever since. I love how clean the place is and how it has so much space! The staff is always so helpful/friendly, but I'm a regular, so they already know my order every time I come here lol.  I always create my own crepe with vanilla ice cream, gram crackers, and whipped cream (I know, it's so plain). I used to get my crepe with Nutella, almonds, and mochi too, but I just got so tired of it. I've always wanted to try their waffles also, but I'm never in the mood for it :( maybe one day! Of course, this place deserves a 5 star rating, and I highly recommend it to everyone!

YhhcAIaKZpFK3qeWiaKvHA.text: We really like their selection of crepes, I usually go for the mix, today I tried the maui fever! Delicious, simple, fast service.

_uzj3xqPevnWbkjUFaoBVw.text: I haven't been to a decent crepe place since San Francisco, baby!  This place is fun, friendly, and most importantly:  DELICIOUS!  With such an extensive mix-in list, it's hard not to love.  The crepe itself is very soft and chewy and the fruit is fresh.  The waffles are amazing as well.  I usually get mine piled high with whipped cream and ice cream and skip the syrup [although they usually thoughtfully put it on the side but I think it's too sweet if placed all together].  While I can't say it beats SF, it's definitely a close second!  Even though it's out of the way, it's definitely worth swinging by for a delicious crepe or waffle!

4x3PvIyHchzq-_RXl45Ifw.text: Neat crepes and fancy waffles! I'd come here often as my default dessert place if I didn't live so far. The best thing about their menu is that you can choose a pre-made combination or choose your own toppings! My favorite is the Rebel special, but the Apple pie a la mode comes pretty close (both on crepes). The crepe itself is okay and I haven't tried the waffle yet.   High ceiling lobby with cleanly tables and chairs. I like just chilling there with a buddy on a normal day. The staff is polite how it should be.   If you haven't yet, try it out! You won't regret it. Even if you live far like me, it'll be worth the commute.

cd4QplAw1YacaFipBnBESA.text: First off, this place serves Thrifty ice cream!!! That alone makes this my favorite dessert joint in Vegas. Their fruits are always fresh, service is excellent and crepes are delicious!  Favorite- Rebel crepe: strawberry, banana, nutella + vanilla ice cream & whip cream  Tip: Wednesday special- $1.50 a scoop. WINNINGS!

LlYPRNWxN3gGa7aqExL5SA.text: We come here often but I don't usually yelp it. Dessert heaven. The smell when u walk in is to die for. We got thrifty ice cream scoops and daughter got a smores crepe. 10 bucks ! Value and quality. Service is always fast and friendly.  Never had a bad day in here

iU3s1tkU6z9mAaw0_DaL6g.text: Very fun and inviting environment, board games kids could play, very open for the space provided, it was amazing. I've been there numourous times and they are always so persistent in making sure their customer is satisfied. A little pricey.

zY-saMpZU3Rq_4XEc0DB9A.text: I love coming here! This was my favorite on hot days after I would get out of high school lol. Now I bring my family here since I moved to California and they love it just as much!  Only thing is they don't put more than two ice cream scoops in your crepe and you can't do an add on on the side you have to buy an actual scoop of ice cream but other than that it's great!

Qxy5u10d-BY1uMFGLNcCNw.text: A friend of mine recommended we give this place a try for some yummy dessert. He was definitely onto something. The place is clean and bright; there are tables and board games inviting you to stay and enjoy your dessert. The staff is friendly and efficient at getting you your treats in record time. You can even watch them make the crepes right in front of you.    On my first visit I had the Rebel Special - strawberries, banana, and Nutella - how can  you go wrong? I chose to have vanilla ice cream on mine and was not disappointed. The crepe was light and a perfect compliment to the filling. My husband had the bananas foster - banana, brown sugar, cinnamon, and caramel - my only wish was that the filling was warm.   On our next visit I was craving apple pie, did I mention I was nine months pregnant? They had the perfect solution, the apple a la mode - apple, sugar, cinnamon, caramel, and graham cracker. It was almost like a slice of pie with a scoop of vanilla ice cream on top. Again, I wished that the filling was warm, but it definitely hit the spot and quelled my pregnancy craving.   I am excited to try out some of the other combinations, I get the feeling you can't go wrong. I love that you can easily eat them without utensils, you just bite right in. This is a light and delicious treat that won't leave you feeling guilty, so go give it a try! Oh and get the punch card, you'll need it!

jl6yIA3VvSVKxJfao0garA.text: Soo yummy! Love coming here when we are in Las Vegas! Everything from Waffles to Crepes is delicious. Plan on trying everything from here. Love that it's clean and everything is done with care and not sloppy.

Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Bananas Foster Waffle

ygca5y4kZRSbQvkdZ-2EsQ.text: I don't always Yelp, but when I do, I mean business! This place is absolutely worth stopping in. Great customer service and extraordinary waffle and crepes.  The bananas foster waffle was to die for and brought back childhood memories!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Bananas Foster Waffle

kP_zSeHAqItk4-7J385v0w.text: This place is great! Why you ask? What human being wouldn't want ice cream or sweets with their breakfast?! Waffles? Crepes? Don't worry, you don't have to pick between one or the other. They have the best of both worlds right here in this one special location! You can get fruit, yogurt, cookies, different syrups, ice cream and even cookie dough bites on either a giant waffle or inside a handmade Japanese style crepe! I highly recommend this place for anyone with a sweet tooth!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. The menu!

V0mpXqsKdjeBUWUqYZK7Zg.text: Staff reminded me of NK troops or something.. very unfriendly and the food was ok.. it felt really weird being in there

jA_e_6REa94r1y9kMFjA1w.text: This place changed the way I look at ice cream, I've been fine with cones my whole life, but had no idea I was settling for an inferior ice cream delivery system. Crepes have obsoleted cones in my mind for ice cream containing purposes. Crepes are the future.   This place is clean and well run. I ordered an Elvis and my girl got an apple caramel one, both with vanilla ice cream, both delicious. This little dessert stop prolly played a role in getting me some bedroom attention later on in the evening, so I'm gonna throw in an extra star for making me seem like a romantic.   Thanks place. I recommend this little spot to anyone who's into ice cream, give crepes a try and i promise you'll like it.

uOHurbG-cSd79Bbui9fevA.text: Stopped here on our way out of Vegas. They serve Japanese style crepes, which apparently means crepes rolled up like ice cream cones with filling. Delicious and fun to eat. Followed it with a waffle to split.  They had a large stack of games in the corner, and my friend and I played connect four while we waited and ate the waffle. I lost though, sadness.

Gy7Y2oICv2l23rWYMfy-rg.text: The last time we were in Crepe Shack and Waffles they were experimenting with their menu. They added my favorite Thrifty's ice cream flavor which is and always will be Chocolate Malted Crunch! This tasted delicious in my crepe with mini brownie bites. Shakes were not on their menu but  they still made us one. I thought it was cool and a demonstration of awesome customer service!

Io5rzaT0wdkIs62V5psfVA.text: I love love coming here almost once a week or even maybe twice a week.  If I wasnt cautious with my weight I would probably go here everyday.    Service:  Since I am a regular here already, they know me by face (though not by name, but its okay) they are so friendly and they check up on you after you have received your order and make sure you are doing great.    Decorations: Simple & vibrant   Food/Dessert:  Simply amazing. I go back and forth with the crepes & waffles & I usually make my own works. Probably I will try what they have on the menu.  Great place to come by and enjoy a quick dessert!

ExP3VG_BJk5IS3JER8Xptw.text: The only complaint I can think of for Crepe Shack & Waffles is that they don't have a location closer to home. It would be so dangerous for them to open up shop next to UNLV -- perfect group to target! I would have trouble resisting very frequent visits, lol  Everyone loves stamp cards and Crepe Shack offers them! I am almost finished filling up mine. I believe it's the standard "buy 10 and the 11th is free!" deal.  Also, if you're keen on text message coupons, Crepe Shack also has a text message line you can join. They offer a deal at least twice a month, from what I've noticed. I've seen "rainy day specials" and other cute deals of the sort. It's usually a 10% discount on your order. I would definitely take advantage of the deals more often if I lived closer,  I usually order the "Rebel Special" crepe, which comes with strawberries, bananas, your choice of ice cream, whipped cream, and the game changer - Nutella. Absolute heaven.  *Insert angelical chorus here*  Maybe they should experiment with green tea, like green tea crepes, or something. This seems like the perfect setting for that kind of innovation. They have lots of creative menu items, like "Bananas Foster" and such.  A trip to Crepe Shack & Waffles is always a good trip made, indeed. Can't wait for my next visit!

82Hpf2OXOrtj_yKRWc8cgA.text: I love this place! It just hit the spot. They have pre-planned flavors you can get on a waffle or crepe. They also carry thriftys ice cream. They make the waffles and crepes from scratch. The price is good, the staff is friendly, and the place is clean with fresh ingredients! I'll definitely be back.

FvItJZZqLsWcTlVgw2_o1w.text: :) awesome heavenly crepe. I never got into the cupcake craze, nor was I a big fan of yogurt places (they were just ok). Thank God for Crepe Shack, this is my new go-to spot for yummy dessert!   I had the Strawberry Sensation w/ Nutella. OMG.... it was just right, and satisfied my sweet tooth craving. I went with two friends, it was their first time here too. After dinner for some reason, we started talking about crepes. We were on a MISSION to Crepe Shack. We were all so happy that we decided on this.   The customer service was AMAZING! The girl who was helping us was kind, sweet and helpful. She asked us if this was our first time, and explained what it is and their menu and flavors.  I was so happy about this, b/c at the last dessert place (cupcakes) I went to a few days ago I had a BAD first time experience. But this place did the opposite and we were able to enjoy and savor the crepes we were eating. :)    The place looked cleaned and was very spacious. And for some reason my artistic eye loves the type of purple they used to paint the walls! haha. random like, but yes ambiance is a factor for me. I'll definitely be back! Excited to try the other combinations. :)

nfFknET9A1rfoFWOtwkHSA.text: Stopped in after a downhill dining experience at EN. There were alot of 5-star reviews for this place so we thought this place must be awesome!  I tried the Strawberrry Sensation and wifey got the Rebel Special....  While waiting for our order, the crowd kept getting bigger and the three people making everyone's orders  seemed to get kinda nervous, probably because the crepes and waffles weren't coming out as fast as people were coming in...here's why:  -one person was cooking the crepe  -one person was assembling the crepe  -one person was waiting with a scoop of ice cream to finish the crepe  We finally got our orders, and the verdict??? Great concept, but tastewise just okay. I guess I'm a purist when it comes to crepes being that I've crepe'd well over a hundred times, including the crepe joint in Japantown SF....It was a little too thick for my liking and the vanilla extract was pretty strong.  Execution could use some refining as well...three people should be able to knock out three orders, just like the homeboys at Pier 39 in San Francisco do with  style and finesse, especially if there are more people are coming in, and also now that there's some crepe competition nearby...ALOHA!!!

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Gettin&#39;crowded...
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Berry Sensation
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States

Oaq5JBA_aG3S2aY-r21DsA.text: Came in for a preflight snack and ordered the Nutella and banana crepe. I liked everything except for the crepe. It was not as crispy as I would have liked it and had had before. When watching them make it, they only brown one side, and the batter was a little too thick for me. If they thinned out the batter and browned both sides, maybe.  I'm sure a lot of other people like them, but it's just not or me.

0D_ehQhsSIssBNKDcdru0g.text: So, after a very large meal at Monstah Lobstah, I felt like my sweet to savory ratio was a little off. I remembered that this place was in the area and I've been dying to try it, so we stopped in for a little dessert.  My fella and I decided to share a Rebel Crepe (Japanese crepe filled with banana, strawberry, nutella and an ice cream of our choice - butter pecan). We got our order and started sharing! Everyone has described the flavor of the crepe as a little like a fortune cookie, but I would say it tastes more like a soft version of a sugar cone. Either way, it was delightful and not overly sweet. Since I prefer my desserts a little on the less sweet side, I probably would prefer this treat without the ice cream, but it did add a bit of interesting flavor punch to this dessert.   About halfway through sharing my fella decided he wanted his own dessert and ordered his next crepe with banana, strawberry and white chocolate. He loved this one even more. I wasn't able to finish my entire crepe, but so might be a great idea to share if you're not super super hungry.   All in all, great little dessert spot. I'd come back if I'm in the area.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Crepe

uBVZ6Wb-jG05hkxvRIrJCQ.text: After having a savory crepe at Suzuya, when I got home, my tummy was telling me "Mike, it's time.. for a sweet one". I thought to myself, "Where is a place close to my house that sells crepes?" And I remembered, CS&W. I jumped in my car, and went here ASAP!!  CS&W is located on Eastern, past Horizon Ridge, in the same complex as Trader Joe's and Sears. It's a new place that has been opened for less than 2 years and has been getting rave reviews on yelp.  Inside, the store is clean, really clean. It has a modern vibe, furthermore, it is bright and airy. The staff is very friendly, professional, but very approachable. After ordering, I sat down and waited. After about a few minutes, they brought my order to me.  Rebel Special Crepe - Strawberries, Nutella, Bananas. I added the vanilla ice cream and whipped cream. The crepe is more chewier than the ones at Suzuya or Crepe Expectations. It tasted O.K., just o.k. The nutella sauce they used was amazing. The bananas tasted good too. The whipped cream and Thrifty brand ice cream were very good. But, I do have a couple gripes. Now, I'm not a big fan of overly sweet desserts. But, IMO, this could have used some more sweetness. Also, the strawberries had little flavor. Maybe if they used Harry's berries, it could have been better. The crepe was a 3.  Classic Waffle - Nutella, Bananas, Toasted Almonds. This time I added whipped cream and Thrifty's Cookies and Cream Ice cream. They also put a side of pancake syrup in a small container for me. For my personal preference, I'm not really into soft waffles. But, even though it was soft, the waffle had really good flavor. The nutella sauce, bananas, ice cream, almonds, and whipped cream were very good. What really elevated the waffle was the pancake syrup. It provided the right amount of sweetness for this dish, and it tied all the flavors together. Without the syrup, like the crepe, it wouldn't have been sweet enough. A big 4 to 4.5 for this one.  I spent about 5 to 6 dollars for each item, it's a very good deal. I would recommend the waffle over the crepe, and I do urge you to get the pancake syrup and pour it on top before you eat it. That's my story and i'm sticking to it. Good day, sir.

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Classic Waffle - Nutella, Bananas, Toasted Almonds - Added Cookies and Cream I.C., Whipped cream, and a side of pancake syrup
Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Signature crepe, the rebel special!

Z69l2UR5gFDAJJ44LL-EmA.text: MUST GO!!!!! I've been going to Crepe Shack and Waffles for awhile now and it seems like their product gets better every time. I usually get the "Not So Plain Waffle" it's a plain waffle cut into forth and dusted with powder sugar & cinnamon. It comes with a dab of whip cream (I can tell it's freshly made) and a side of syrup. The waffles are light and crispy, basically everything one can wish for in a waffle.  In addition, the crepes are amazing as well. This place sells "Japanese style" crepes which means the crepes and rolled into a "cone" shape and inside is filed with fresh fruits, toppings, ice cream, and whip cream.  Overall, the place is bright, clean, and well organized. The employees are very friendly and helpful. I will definalty be going back!

HYotwHY6-FnIlWvS6-urKQ.text: This place is awesome! I brought my kids here for a meal and they absolutely loved it. The service was great and he helped us through the whole process. I got one of their most popular crepes, I can't remember the name offhand but it tasted great. Definitely something I would try again and bring my family to again. It's a very family oriented environment!

rudHp4XsCPcl3ouEVNfDPA.text: Fun place, dessert crepes w ice cream!.. I'm going back, especially when the warm weather hits.

1TB4jY2JccBUOTJsUhWmoA.text: Cute place, very bright and airy. Love that they have board games and magazines available for customers to while they enjoy there tasty treats. The reason I had to try this place was the fact that they promote they have thrifty ice cream (which is one of my guilty pleasures!) To my surprise they have special blended thrifty ice cream flavors in addition to a few of the classic flavors.   The first time I came here I just had ice cream and enjoyed every bite. The second time I actually tried a crepe which was really good. I found it interesting that they make the crepe in front of you then fill it with ice creme and topping. The crepe then acts like a ice cream cone. :-) Another option they offer is a Belgian waffle that you can top with ice cream and other toppings. (I'm saving that option for when I have someone to share with.) If you have issues with making topping decisions the menu offers quite a few signature combos  that are sure to satisfy any taste bud cravings!     I will definitely be back when I sweet craving hits. Very tasty treat suitable for all ages!!! ;-)

photos.caption: Photo of Crepe Shack & Waffles - Henderson, NV, United States. Bananas foster crepe

4W1wYwmf2ojOH_XBaWo3ew.text: Excellent waffles &crepes.   I Almost tried everything. I have my 3 stampcard now.  :-)))) Really Great quality of fruits & the Crepes & waffles are always Wow.    Stuff is extraordinary friendly.   I Love to go there 1 a week. Hubby & i are always excited to go there.   3 Things i would Love to See on the regular menu Tango Mango  Red Bean icecream ( i m really in Love with it) Boba Shakes   I will be back soon.

Jn9d77Q-JXM2awmyIlfyRA.text: We have been coming to this place for years.  They have become a weekend staple for a breakfast/lunch alternative.  The fruit is always fresh and the crepes are awesome! If you have never had Japanese crepes, they are served very thin and are in a cone shape for a hand held treat.  I always get the Rebel Special (love me some Nutella!).  My husband typically gets the Maui Fever.  Everything is really good though, never a complaint! As for decor, its a standard ice cream shop atmosphere.  They have board games for kids to play as well.  I just wish they would serve coffee!   *Get the punch card - every 10th crepe/waffle is free!*

W4UnrgxasL7oWX56Uzckdg.text: Wandering the local shops and checking out parts of Nevada I'd never before had the chance to explore a later stop would take me to "Crepe Shack & Waffles," another Henderson newcomer where I at first considered another waffle but instead went with a crepe - the right choice, I'm rather certain, as the fluffy and light disk was made-to-order by a friendly young woman named Sandra and subsequently rolled into a cone and stuffed chock-a-block full of Banana Nut Ice Cream, Brown Sugar, Cinnamon, Fresh Bananas, Caramel, and a dash of Sea Salt.  Apparently a Japanese trend now gaining popularity on both coasts and featuring a large, spacious, and modern look with friendly servers, myriad options, and great prices ($5 for a crepe cone, $6 for a topped waffle) this is definitely a trend I can support, though in an ideal situation a place doing such a thing with house-made ice creams and condiments would be all the more appealing - and to find that in Vegas I think the best option is a crepe and some ice cream or gelato at Jean-Philippe in the Bellagio at nearly twice the price.

fCX-2HkENeoAGlwHqrUAxA.text: First time ever having a crepe. I got the Tickle Me Berry Crepe (Blackberry/Blueberry/Strawberry) with Green Tea Ice Cream. Delicious and the fruit was fresh. My new fav ice cream place!

81EMn6qfcjfo15Uw1VVgAg.text: Good place for a lazy afternoon or afterschool snack with the kids (or friends). We tried the Japanese crepe and loved it. We only like to drink water after eating something sweet. So we were a bit bummed to find out that they only serve tap water. So bring your own water or be ready to pay more than a dollar per bottle. They have board games you can use while hanging out or waiting for your order.  We'll come back next time we crave something similar.

9xL_RaFxqH66U8YyNZjWgQ.text: This ws my First, but Definitely Not My Last. After that first bite, I was hooked. I know there are other Crepe Eateries around the Vegas Area, but this one was Close to where I was. It's located in the Anthem Area, where the Kmart & Trader Joe's stores are. This place has Bonus Points for me, because they have a Trader Joe's and a Pet Store that I love going in to ...just to play with the Puppies! Yes, I'm THAT Weird, hahaha....Anyway, This Establishment is at the far end of the building. The Parking can get a little Congested because of all the other Establishments in the area. But, Going here is Well Worth it... The Prices are Very Reasonable, and the Staff is/are Very Friendly! The Establisment is Very Clean, and you can see your Crepe being made while you wait!!!   Chances are I will be back when I head back to my 2nd home again! Love, Love, Love it!!!!!  Nuff Said...  =)
